module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.App

-- | An individual Firewall Manager application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApp</a> smart constructor.
data App
App' :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> App

-- | The application's name.
[$sel:appName:App'] :: App -> Text

-- | The IP protocol name or number. The name can be one of <tt>tcp</tt>,
--   <tt>udp</tt>, or <tt>icmp</tt>. For information on possible numbers,
--   see <a>Protocol Numbers</a>.
[$sel:protocol:App'] :: App -> Text

-- | The application's port number, for example <tt>80</tt>.

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager applications list was last updated.

-- | A map of previous version numbers to their corresponding <tt>App</tt>
--   object arrays.
[$sel:previousAppsList:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> Maybe (HashMap Text [App])

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the list. When you update the

--   the application list. You can retrieve the update token by getting the
--   list.

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager applications list.

[$sel:appsList:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> [App]

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DestinationType.DestinationType


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation

-- | A DNS Firewall rule group that Firewall Manager tried to associate
--   with a VPC is already associated with the VPC and can't be associated
--   again.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation
DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:violationTarget:DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation'] :: DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the violation that specifies the rule group and VPC.
[$sel:violationTargetDescription:DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation'] :: DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation_violationTarget</a> - Information
--   about the VPC ID.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTargetDescription:DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation_violationTargetDescription</a> - A
--   description of the violation that specifies the rule group and VPC.
newDnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation :: DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the violation that specifies the rule group and VPC.
dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation_violationTargetDescription :: Lens' DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation.DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation

-- | The VPC that Firewall Manager was applying a DNS Fireall policy to
--   reached the limit for associated DNS Firewall rule groups. Firewall
--   Manager tried to associate another rule group with the VPC and failed
--   due to the limit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation
DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:violationTarget:DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the violation that specifies the rule group and VPC.
[$sel:violationTargetDescription:DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of rule groups currently associated with the VPC.
[$sel:numberOfRuleGroupsAlreadyAssociated:DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation_violationTarget</a> -
--   Information about the VPC ID.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTargetDescription:DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation_violationTargetDescription</a> -
--   A description of the violation that specifies the rule group and VPC.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRuleGroupsAlreadyAssociated:DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation_numberOfRuleGroupsAlreadyAssociated</a>
--   - The number of rule groups currently associated with the VPC.
newDnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation :: DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the violation that specifies the rule group and VPC.
dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation_violationTargetDescription :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of rule groups currently associated with the VPC.
dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation_numberOfRuleGroupsAlreadyAssociated :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation.DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation

-- | A rule group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC has
--   the same priority as a rule group that's already associated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation
DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Natural] -> Maybe Text -> DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:violationTarget:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The priority setting of the two conflicting rule groups.
[$sel:conflictingPriority:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe Natural

-- | A description of the violation that specifies the VPC and the rule
--   group that's already associated with it.
[$sel:violationTargetDescription:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The priorities of rule groups that are already associated with the
--   VPC. To retry your operation, choose priority settings that aren't in
--   this list for the rule groups in your new DNS Firewall policy.
[$sel:unavailablePriorities:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe [Natural]

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager DNS Firewall policy that was already
--   applied to the VPC. This policy contains the rule group that's already
--   associated with the VPC.
[$sel:conflictingPolicyId:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_violationTarget</a> -
--   Information about the VPC ID.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:conflictingPriority:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_conflictingPriority</a> - The
--   priority setting of the two conflicting rule groups.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTargetDescription:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_violationTargetDescription</a>
--   - A description of the violation that specifies the VPC and the rule
--   group that's already associated with it.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:unavailablePriorities:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_unavailablePriorities</a> -
--   The priorities of rule groups that are already associated with the
--   VPC. To retry your operation, choose priority settings that aren't in
--   this list for the rule groups in your new DNS Firewall policy.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:conflictingPolicyId:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'</a>,
--   <a>dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_conflictingPolicyId</a> - The
--   ID of the Firewall Manager DNS Firewall policy that was already
--   applied to the VPC. This policy contains the rule group that's already
--   associated with the VPC.
newDnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The priority setting of the two conflicting rule groups.
dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_conflictingPriority :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation (Maybe Natural)

-- | A description of the violation that specifies the VPC and the rule
--   group that's already associated with it.
dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_violationTargetDescription :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The priorities of rule groups that are already associated with the
--   VPC. To retry your operation, choose priority settings that aren't in
--   this list for the rule groups in your new DNS Firewall policy.
dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_unavailablePriorities :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation (Maybe [Natural])

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager DNS Firewall policy that was already
--   applied to the VPC. This policy contains the rule group that's already
--   associated with the VPC.
dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation_conflictingPolicyId :: Lens' DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation.DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation.DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation.DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EC2AssociateRouteTableAction

-- | The action of associating an EC2 resource, such as a subnet or
--   internet gateway, with a route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEC2AssociateRouteTableAction</a> smart constructor.
data EC2AssociateRouteTableAction
EC2AssociateRouteTableAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionTarget -> Maybe ActionTarget -> ActionTarget -> EC2AssociateRouteTableAction

-- | A description of the EC2 route table that is associated with the
--   remediation action.
[$sel:description:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'] :: EC2AssociateRouteTableAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the subnet for the EC2 route table that is associated with
--   the remediation action.
[$sel:subnetId:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'] :: EC2AssociateRouteTableAction -> Maybe ActionTarget

-- | The ID of the gateway to be used with the EC2 route table that is
--   associated with the remediation action.
[$sel:gatewayId:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'] :: EC2AssociateRouteTableAction -> Maybe ActionTarget

-- | The ID of the EC2 route table that is associated with the remediation
--   action.
[$sel:routeTableId:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'] :: EC2AssociateRouteTableAction -> ActionTarget

-- | Create a value of <a>EC2AssociateRouteTableAction</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_description</a> - A description of the
--   EC2 route table that is associated with the remediation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetId:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_subnetId</a> - The ID of the subnet
--   for the EC2 route table that is associated with the remediation
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_gatewayId</a> - The ID of the gateway
--   to be used with the EC2 route table that is associated with the
--   remediation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:EC2AssociateRouteTableAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_routeTableId</a> - The ID of the EC2
--   route table that is associated with the remediation action.
newEC2AssociateRouteTableAction :: ActionTarget -> EC2AssociateRouteTableAction

--   remediation action.
eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_description :: Lens' EC2AssociateRouteTableAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the subnet for the EC2 route table that is associated with
--   the remediation action.
eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_subnetId :: Lens' EC2AssociateRouteTableAction (Maybe ActionTarget)

-- | The ID of the gateway to be used with the EC2 route table that is
--   associated with the remediation action.
eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_gatewayId :: Lens' EC2AssociateRouteTableAction (Maybe ActionTarget)

-- | The ID of the EC2 route table that is associated with the remediation
--   action.
eC2AssociateRouteTableAction_routeTableId :: Lens' EC2AssociateRouteTableAction ActionTarget

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EC2CreateRouteAction

-- | Information about the CreateRoute action in Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEC2CreateRouteAction</a> smart constructor.
data EC2CreateRouteAction
EC2CreateRouteAction' :: Maybe ActionTarget -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionTarget -> ActionTarget -> EC2CreateRouteAction

-- | Information about the ID of a VPC endpoint. Supported for Gateway Load
--   Balancer endpoints only.
[$sel:vpcEndpointId:EC2CreateRouteAction'] :: EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe ActionTarget

-- | Information about the ID of a prefix list used for the destination
--   match.
[$sel:destinationPrefixListId:EC2CreateRouteAction'] :: EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the IPv6 CIDR block destination.
[$sel:destinationIpv6CidrBlock:EC2CreateRouteAction'] :: EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the IPv4 CIDR address block used for the destination
--   match.
[$sel:destinationCidrBlock:EC2CreateRouteAction'] :: EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of CreateRoute action in Amazon EC2.
[$sel:description:EC2CreateRouteAction'] :: EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the ID of an internet gateway or virtual private
--   gateway attached to your VPC.
[$sel:gatewayId:EC2CreateRouteAction'] :: EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe ActionTarget

-- | Information about the ID of the route table for the route.
[$sel:routeTableId:EC2CreateRouteAction'] :: EC2CreateRouteAction -> ActionTarget

-- | Create a value of <a>EC2CreateRouteAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcEndpointId:EC2CreateRouteAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2CreateRouteAction_vpcEndpointId</a> - Information about the ID
--   of a VPC endpoint. Supported for Gateway Load Balancer endpoints only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationPrefixListId:EC2CreateRouteAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2CreateRouteAction_destinationPrefixListId</a> - Information
--   about the ID of a prefix list used for the destination match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationIpv6CidrBlock:EC2CreateRouteAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2CreateRouteAction_destinationIpv6CidrBlock</a> - Information
--   about the IPv6 CIDR block destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationCidrBlock:EC2CreateRouteAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2CreateRouteAction_destinationCidrBlock</a> - Information about
--   the IPv4 CIDR address block used for the destination match.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:EC2CreateRouteAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2CreateRouteAction_description</a> - A description of CreateRoute
--   action in Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:EC2CreateRouteAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2CreateRouteAction_gatewayId</a> - Information about the ID of an
--   internet gateway or virtual private gateway attached to your VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:EC2CreateRouteAction'</a>,
--   <a>eC2CreateRouteAction_routeTableId</a> - Information about the ID of
--   the route table for the route.
newEC2CreateRouteAction :: ActionTarget -> EC2CreateRouteAction

--   Balancer endpoints only.
eC2CreateRouteAction_vpcEndpointId :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteAction (Maybe ActionTarget)

--   match.
eC2CreateRouteAction_destinationPrefixListId :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteAction (Maybe Text)

eC2CreateRouteAction_destinationIpv6CidrBlock :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the IPv4 CIDR address block used for the destination
--   match.
eC2CreateRouteAction_destinationCidrBlock :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteAction (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of CreateRoute action in Amazon EC2.
eC2CreateRouteAction_description :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the ID of an internet gateway or virtual private
--   gateway attached to your VPC.
eC2CreateRouteAction_gatewayId :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteAction (Maybe ActionTarget)

-- | Information about the ID of the route table for the route.
eC2CreateRouteAction_routeTableId :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteAction ActionTarget

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EC2CreateRouteAction.EC2CreateRouteAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EC2CreateRouteAction.EC2CreateRouteAction

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EC2CreateRouteAction.EC2CreateRouteAction

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EC2CreateRouteTableAction

-- | Information about the CreateRouteTable action in Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEC2CreateRouteTableAction</a> smart constructor.
data EC2CreateRouteTableAction

--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   CreateRouteTable action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:EC2CreateRouteTableAction'</a>,

--   VPC.
newEC2CreateRouteTableAction :: ActionTarget -> EC2CreateRouteTableAction

-- | A description of the CreateRouteTable action.
eC2CreateRouteTableAction_description :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteTableAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the ID of a VPC.
eC2CreateRouteTableAction_vpcId :: Lens' EC2CreateRouteTableAction ActionTarget

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EC2CreateRouteTableAction.EC2CreateRouteTableAction

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ExpectedRoute

-- | Information about the expected route in the route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExpectedRoute</a> smart constructor.
data ExpectedRoute
ExpectedRoute' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> ExpectedRoute

-- | Information about the IPv4 CIDR block.
[$sel:ipV4Cidr:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the IPv6 CIDR block.
[$sel:ipV6Cidr:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the allowed targets.
[$sel:allowedTargets:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Information about the route table ID.
[$sel:routeTableId:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the ID of the prefix list for the route.
[$sel:prefixListId:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the contributing subnets.
[$sel:contributingSubnets:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ExpectedRoute</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipV4Cidr:ExpectedRoute'</a>, <a>expectedRoute_ipV4Cidr</a> -
--   Information about the IPv4 CIDR block.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipV6Cidr:ExpectedRoute'</a>, <a>expectedRoute_ipV6Cidr</a> -
--   Information about the IPv6 CIDR block.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedTargets:ExpectedRoute'</a>,
--   <a>expectedRoute_allowedTargets</a> - Information about the allowed
--   targets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:ExpectedRoute'</a>,
--   <a>expectedRoute_routeTableId</a> - Information about the route table
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefixListId:ExpectedRoute'</a>,
--   <a>expectedRoute_prefixListId</a> - Information about the ID of the
--   prefix list for the route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contributingSubnets:ExpectedRoute'</a>,
--   <a>expectedRoute_contributingSubnets</a> - Information about the
--   contributing subnets.
newExpectedRoute :: ExpectedRoute

-- | Information about the IPv4 CIDR block.
expectedRoute_ipV4Cidr :: Lens' ExpectedRoute (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the IPv6 CIDR block.
expectedRoute_ipV6Cidr :: Lens' ExpectedRoute (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the allowed targets.
expectedRoute_allowedTargets :: Lens' ExpectedRoute (Maybe [Text])

-- | Information about the route table ID.
expectedRoute_routeTableId :: Lens' ExpectedRoute (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the ID of the prefix list for the route.
expectedRoute_prefixListId :: Lens' ExpectedRoute (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the contributing subnets.
expectedRoute_contributingSubnets :: Lens' ExpectedRoute (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ExpectedRoute.ExpectedRoute
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ExpectedRoute.ExpectedRoute

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation

-- | Violation detail for Network Firewall for a subnet that's not
--   associated to the expected Firewall Manager managed route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation
NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation

-- | The resource ID of the current route table that's associated with the
--   subnet, if one is available.
[$sel:currentRouteTable:NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
[$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.
[$sel:availabilityZone:NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource ID of the route table that should be associated with the
--   subnet.
[$sel:expectedRouteTable:NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource ID of the VPC associated with a violating subnet.
[$sel:vpc:NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.

--   The resource ID of the current route table that's associated with the
--   subnet, if one is available.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation_violationTarget</a> - The
--   ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation_availabilityZone</a> -
--   The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.
--

-- | The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.
networkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation_availabilityZone :: Lens' NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation (Maybe Text)

--   subnet.

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation

-- | Violation detail for Network Firewall for a subnet that doesn't have a
--   Firewall Manager managed firewall in its VPC.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation

-- | The reason the resource has this violation, if one is available.
[$sel:targetViolationReason:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
[$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.
[$sel:availabilityZone:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource ID of the VPC associated with a violating subnet.
[$sel:vpc:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetViolationReason:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_targetViolationReason</a> -
--   The reason the resource has this violation, if one is available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_violationTarget</a> - The
--   ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_availabilityZone</a> - The
--   Availability Zone of a violating subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_vpc</a> - The resource ID
--   of the VPC associated with a violating subnet.
newNetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation :: NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation

-- | The reason the resource has this violation, if one is available.
networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_targetViolationReason :: Lens' NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone of a violating subnet.
networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_availabilityZone :: Lens' NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource ID of the VPC associated with a violating subnet.
networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation_vpc :: Lens' NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation.NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation

-- | Violation detail for Network Firewall for an Availability Zone that's
--   missing the expected Firewall Manager managed subnet.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation
NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation

-- | The reason the resource has this violation, if one is available.
[$sel:targetViolationReason:NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation -> Maybe Text

--   the VPC associated with a violating subnet.

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch

-- | The reference rule that partially matches the <tt>ViolationTarget</tt>
--   rule and violation reason.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPartialMatch</a> smart constructor.
data PartialMatch
PartialMatch' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> PartialMatch

-- | The violation reason.
[$sel:targetViolationReasons:PartialMatch'] :: PartialMatch -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The reference rule from the primary security group of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
[$sel:reference:PartialMatch'] :: PartialMatch -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PartialMatch</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetViolationReasons:PartialMatch'</a>,
--   <a>partialMatch_targetViolationReasons</a> - The violation reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reference:PartialMatch'</a>, <a>partialMatch_reference</a> -
--   The reference rule from the primary security group of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
newPartialMatch :: PartialMatch

-- | The violation reason.
partialMatch_targetViolationReasons :: Lens' PartialMatch (Maybe [Text])

-- | The reference rule from the primary security group of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
partialMatch_reference :: Lens' PartialMatch (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch.PartialMatch
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch.PartialMatch
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch.PartialMatch
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch.PartialMatch
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch.PartialMatch
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch.PartialMatch
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PartialMatch.PartialMatch


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatusType

[fromPolicyComplianceStatusType] :: PolicyComplianceStatusType -> Text
pattern PolicyComplianceStatusType_COMPLIANT :: PolicyComplianceStatusType
pattern PolicyComplianceStatusType_NON_COMPLIANT :: PolicyComplianceStatusType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatusType.PolicyComplianceStatusType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatusType.PolicyComplianceStatusType

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatusType.PolicyComplianceStatusType


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult

-- | Describes the compliance status for the account. An account is
--   considered noncompliant if it includes resources that are not
--   protected by the specified policy or that don't comply with the
--   policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvaluationResult</a> smart constructor.
data EvaluationResult
EvaluationResult' :: Maybe PolicyComplianceStatusType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> EvaluationResult

-- | Describes an Amazon Web Services account's compliance with the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:complianceStatus:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe PolicyComplianceStatusType

-- | Indicates that over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
[$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of resources that are noncompliant with the specified
--   policy. For WAF and Shield Advanced policies, a resource is considered
--   noncompliant if it is not associated with the policy. For security
--   group policies, a resource is considered noncompliant if it doesn't
--   comply with the rules of the policy and remediation is disabled or not
--   possible.
[$sel:violatorCount:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>EvaluationResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceStatus:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_complianceStatus</a> - Describes an Amazon Web
--   Services account's compliance with the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evaluationLimitExceeded</a> - Indicates that over
--   100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatorCount:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_violatorCount</a> - The number of resources that
--   are noncompliant with the specified policy. For WAF and Shield
--   Advanced policies, a resource is considered noncompliant if it is not
--   associated with the policy. For security group policies, a resource is
--   considered noncompliant if it doesn't comply with the rules of the
--   policy and remediation is disabled or not possible.
newEvaluationResult :: EvaluationResult

-- | Describes an Amazon Web Services account's compliance with the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
evaluationResult_complianceStatus :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe PolicyComplianceStatusType)

-- | Indicates that over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
evaluationResult_evaluationLimitExceeded :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of resources that are noncompliant with the specified
--   policy. For WAF and Shield Advanced policies, a resource is considered
--   noncompliant if it is not associated with the policy. For security
--   group policies, a resource is considered noncompliant if it doesn't
--   comply with the rules of the policy and remediation is disabled or not
--   possible.
evaluationResult_violatorCount :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus

-- | Indicates whether the account is compliant with the specified policy.
--   An account is considered noncompliant if it includes resources that
--   are not protected by the policy, for WAF and Shield Advanced policies,
--   or that are noncompliant with the policy, for security group policies.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyComplianceStatus</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyComplianceStatus
PolicyComplianceStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [EvaluationResult] -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text) -> Maybe Text -> PolicyComplianceStatus

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyName:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager
--   policy.
[$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The member account ID.
[$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Timestamp of the last update to the <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
[$sel:lastUpdated:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An array of <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
[$sel:evaluationResults:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe [EvaluationResult]

-- | Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config,
--   and the error message received that indicates the problem with the
--   service.
[$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text)

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyComplianceStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_policyName</a> - The name of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_policyOwner</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account that created the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_memberAccount</a> - The member account ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_lastUpdated</a> - Timestamp of the last
--   update to the <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationResults:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_evaluationResults</a> - An array of
--   <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_issueInfoMap</a> - Details about problems
--   with dependent services, such as WAF or Config, and the error message
--   received that indicates the problem with the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_policyId</a> - The ID of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
newPolicyComplianceStatus :: PolicyComplianceStatus

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager policy.
policyComplianceStatus_policyName :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager
--   policy.
policyComplianceStatus_policyOwner :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The member account ID.
policyComplianceStatus_memberAccount :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | Timestamp of the last update to the <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
policyComplianceStatus_lastUpdated :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An array of <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
policyComplianceStatus_evaluationResults :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe [EvaluationResult])

-- | Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config,
--   and the error message received that indicates the problem with the
--   service.
policyComplianceStatus_issueInfoMap :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text))

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
policyComplianceStatus_policyId :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus.PolicyComplianceStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus.PolicyComplianceStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus.PolicyComplianceStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus.PolicyComplianceStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus.PolicyComplianceStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus.PolicyComplianceStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceStatus.PolicyComplianceStatus


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData

-- | An Firewall Manager protocols list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtocolsListData</a> smart constructor.
data ProtocolsListData
ProtocolsListData' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [Text] -> ProtocolsListData

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdateTime:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:listId:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was created.
[$sel:createTime:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A map of previous version numbers to their corresponding protocol
--   arrays.
[$sel:previousProtocolsList:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the list. When you update the
--   list, the update token must match the token of the current version of
--   the application list. You can retrieve the update token by getting the
--   list.
[$sel:listUpdateToken:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:listName:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Text

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtocolsListData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTime:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_lastUpdateTime</a> - The time that the Firewall
--   Manager protocols list was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listId:ProtocolsListData'</a>, <a>protocolsListData_listId</a>
--   - The ID of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTime:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_createTime</a> - The time that the Firewall
--   Manager protocols list was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previousProtocolsList:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_previousProtocolsList</a> - A map of previous
--   version numbers to their corresponding protocol arrays.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listUpdateToken:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_listUpdateToken</a> - A unique identifier for
--   each update to the list. When you update the list, the update token
--   must match the token of the current version of the application list.
--   You can retrieve the update token by getting the list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listName:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_listName</a> - The name of the Firewall Manager
--   protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_protocolsList</a> - An array of protocols in the
--   Firewall Manager protocols list.
newProtocolsListData :: Text -> ProtocolsListData

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was last updated.
protocolsListData_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListData_listId :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was created.
protocolsListData_createTime :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of previous version numbers to their corresponding protocol
--   arrays.
protocolsListData_previousProtocolsList :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the list. When you update the
--   list, the update token must match the token of the current version of
--   the application list. You can retrieve the update token by getting the
--   list.
protocolsListData_listUpdateToken :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListData_listName :: Lens' ProtocolsListData Text

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListData_protocolsList :: Lens' ProtocolsListData [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListData.ProtocolsListData


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary

-- | Details of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtocolsListDataSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ProtocolsListDataSummary
ProtocolsListDataSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> ProtocolsListDataSummary

-- | The name of the specified protocols list.
[$sel:listName:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the specified protocols list.
[$sel:listId:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified protocols list.
[$sel:listArn:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtocolsListDataSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:listName:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_listName</a> - The name of the specified
--   protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listId:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_listId</a> - The ID of the specified
--   protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listArn:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_listArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the specified protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_protocolsList</a> - An array of protocols
--   in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
newProtocolsListDataSummary :: ProtocolsListDataSummary

-- | The name of the specified protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_listName :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the specified protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_listId :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_listArn :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_protocolsList :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary.ProtocolsListDataSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary.ProtocolsListDataSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary.ProtocolsListDataSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary.ProtocolsListDataSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary.ProtocolsListDataSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary.ProtocolsListDataSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ProtocolsListDataSummary.ProtocolsListDataSummary


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationAction

-- | Information about an individual action you can take to remediate a
--   violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemediationAction</a> smart constructor.
data RemediationAction
RemediationAction' :: Maybe EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteAction -> Maybe EC2AssociateRouteTableAction -> Maybe EC2CreateRouteTableAction -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EC2CopyRouteTableAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction -> Maybe EC2DeleteRouteAction -> RemediationAction

-- | Information about the CreateRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2CreateRouteAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2CreateRouteAction

-- | Information about the ReplaceRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteAction

-- | Information about the AssociateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2
--   API.
[$sel:eC2AssociateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2AssociateRouteTableAction

-- | Information about the CreateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2CreateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2CreateRouteTableAction

-- | A description of a remediation action.
[$sel:description:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the CopyRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2CopyRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2CopyRouteTableAction

-- | Information about the ReplaceRouteTableAssociation action in the
--   Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction

-- | Information about the DeleteRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2DeleteRouteAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2DeleteRouteAction

-- | Create a value of <a>RemediationAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2CreateRouteAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2CreateRouteAction</a> - Information about the
--   CreateRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteAction</a> - Information about the
--   ReplaceRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2AssociateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2AssociateRouteTableAction</a> - Information
--   about the AssociateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2CreateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2CreateRouteTableAction</a> - Information about
--   the CreateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_description</a> - A description of a remediation
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2CopyRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2CopyRouteTableAction</a> - Information about
--   the CopyRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction</a> -
--   Information about the ReplaceRouteTableAssociation action in the
--   Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2DeleteRouteAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2DeleteRouteAction</a> - Information about the
--   DeleteRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
newRemediationAction :: RemediationAction

-- | Information about the CreateRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2CreateRouteAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2CreateRouteAction)

-- | Information about the ReplaceRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteAction)

-- | Information about the AssociateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2
--   API.
remediationAction_eC2AssociateRouteTableAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2AssociateRouteTableAction)

-- | Information about the CreateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2CreateRouteTableAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2CreateRouteTableAction)

-- | A description of a remediation action.
remediationAction_description :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the CopyRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2CopyRouteTableAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2CopyRouteTableAction)

-- | Information about the ReplaceRouteTableAssociation action in the
--   Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction)

-- | Information about the DeleteRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2DeleteRouteAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2DeleteRouteAction)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationAction.RemediationAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationAction.RemediationAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationAction.RemediationAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationAction.RemediationAction

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationAction.RemediationAction

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationActionWithOrder

-- | An ordered list of actions you can take to remediate a violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemediationActionWithOrder</a> smart constructor.
data RemediationActionWithOrder
RemediationActionWithOrder' :: Maybe RemediationAction -> Maybe Int -> RemediationActionWithOrder

-- | Information about an action you can take to remediate a violation.
[$sel:remediationAction:RemediationActionWithOrder'] :: RemediationActionWithOrder -> Maybe RemediationAction

-- | The order of the remediation actions in the list.
[$sel:order:RemediationActionWithOrder'] :: RemediationActionWithOrder -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RemediationActionWithOrder</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationAction:RemediationActionWithOrder'</a>,
--   <a>remediationActionWithOrder_remediationAction</a> - Information
--   about an action you can take to remediate a violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:order:RemediationActionWithOrder'</a>,
--   <a>remediationActionWithOrder_order</a> - The order of the remediation
--   actions in the list.
newRemediationActionWithOrder :: RemediationActionWithOrder

-- | Information about an action you can take to remediate a violation.
remediationActionWithOrder_remediationAction :: Lens' RemediationActionWithOrder (Maybe RemediationAction)

-- | The order of the remediation actions in the list.
remediationActionWithOrder_order :: Lens' RemediationActionWithOrder (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationActionWithOrder.RemediationActionWithOrder
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.RemediationActionWithOrder.RemediationActionWithOrder
