instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServiceType.SecurityServiceType


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | Details about the security service that is being used to protect the
--   resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSecurityServicePolicyData</a> smart constructor.
data SecurityServicePolicyData
SecurityServicePolicyData' :: Maybe Text -> SecurityServiceType -> SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | Details about the service that are specific to the service type, in
--   JSON format. For service type <tt>SHIELD_ADVANCED</tt>, this is an
--   empty string.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>DNS_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"DNS_FIREWALL\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-1\",\"priority\":10}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-2\",\"priority\":9911}]}"</pre>Valid
--   values for <tt>preProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 1 and 99. Valid
--   values for <tt>postProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 9901 and
--   10000.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>NETWORK_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"NETWORK_FIREWALL\",\"networkFirewallStatelessRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateless-rulegroup/rulegroup2\",\"priority\":10}],\"networkFirewallStatelessDefaultActions\":[\"aws:pass\",\"custom1\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessFragmentDefaultActions\":[\"custom2\",\"aws:pass\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessCustomActions\":[{\"actionName\":\"custom1\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension1\"}]}}},{\"actionName\":\"custom2\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension2\"}]}}}],\"networkFirewallStatefulRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateful-rulegroup/rulegroup1\"}],\"networkFirewallOrchestrationConfig\":{\"singleFirewallEndpointPerVPC\":true,\"allowedIPV4CidrList\":[\"10.24.34.0/28\"]}
--   }"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>WAFV2</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"WAFV2\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupArn\":null,\"overrideAction\":{\"type\":\"NONE\"},\"managedRuleGroupIdentifier\":{\"version\":null,\"vendorName\":\"AWS\",\"managedRuleGroupName\":\"AWSManagedRulesAmazonIpReputationList\"},\"ruleGroupType\":\"ManagedRuleGroup\",\"excludeRules\":[{\"name\":\"NoUserAgent_HEADER\"}]}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[],\"defaultAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"},\"overrideCustomerWebACLAssociation\":false,\"loggingConfiguration\":{\"logDestinationConfigs\":[\"arn:aws:firehose:us-west-2:12345678912:deliverystream/aws-waf-logs-fms-admin-destination\"],\"redactedFields\":[{\"redactedFieldType\":\"SingleHeader\",\"redactedFieldValue\":\"Cookies\"},{\"redactedFieldType\":\"Method\"}]}}"</pre>In
--   the <tt>loggingConfiguration</tt>, you can specify one
--   <tt>logDestinationConfigs</tt>, you can optionally provide up to 20
--   <tt>redactedFields</tt>, and the <tt>RedactedFieldType</tt> must be
--   one of <tt>URI</tt>, <tt>QUERY_STRING</tt>, <tt>HEADER</tt>, or
--   <tt>METHOD</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>WAF Classic</tt><pre>"{\"type\": \"WAF\",
--   \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\":\"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\",
--   \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\":
--   {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example: Shared VPCs. Apply the preceding policy to resources in
--   shared VPCs as well as to those in VPCs that the account
--   owns<pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"includeSharedVPC\":true,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT\",\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}],\"securityGroupAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"}}"</pre>The
--   security group action for content audit can be <tt>ALLOW</tt> or
--   <tt>DENY</tt>. For <tt>ALLOW</tt>, all in-scope security group rules
--   must be within the allowed range of the policy's security group rules.
--   For <tt>DENY</tt>, all in-scope security group rules must not contain
--   a value or a range that matches a rule value or range in the policy
--   security group.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT\",\"deleteUnusedSecurityGroups\":true,\"coalesceRedundantSecurityGroups\":true}"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:managedServiceData:SecurityServicePolicyData'] :: SecurityServicePolicyData -> Maybe Text

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy. For security group
--   policies, Firewall Manager supports one security group for each common
--   policy and for each content audit policy. This is an adjustable limit
--   that you can increase by contacting Amazon Web Services Support.
[$sel:type':SecurityServicePolicyData'] :: SecurityServicePolicyData -> SecurityServiceType

-- | Create a value of <a>SecurityServicePolicyData</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedServiceData:SecurityServicePolicyData'</a>,
--   <a>securityServicePolicyData_managedServiceData</a> - Details about
--   the service that are specific to the service type, in JSON format. For
--   service type <tt>SHIELD_ADVANCED</tt>, this is an empty string.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>DNS_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"DNS_FIREWALL\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-1\",\"priority\":10}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-2\",\"priority\":9911}]}"</pre>Valid
--   values for <tt>preProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 1 and 99. Valid
--   values for <tt>postProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 9901 and
--   10000.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>NETWORK_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"NETWORK_FIREWALL\",\"networkFirewallStatelessRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateless-rulegroup/rulegroup2\",\"priority\":10}],\"networkFirewallStatelessDefaultActions\":[\"aws:pass\",\"custom1\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessFragmentDefaultActions\":[\"custom2\",\"aws:pass\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessCustomActions\":[{\"actionName\":\"custom1\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension1\"}]}}},{\"actionName\":\"custom2\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension2\"}]}}}],\"networkFirewallStatefulRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateful-rulegroup/rulegroup1\"}],\"networkFirewallOrchestrationConfig\":{\"singleFirewallEndpointPerVPC\":true,\"allowedIPV4CidrList\":[\"10.24.34.0/28\"]}
--   }"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>WAFV2</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"WAFV2\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupArn\":null,\"overrideAction\":{\"type\":\"NONE\"},\"managedRuleGroupIdentifier\":{\"version\":null,\"vendorName\":\"AWS\",\"managedRuleGroupName\":\"AWSManagedRulesAmazonIpReputationList\"},\"ruleGroupType\":\"ManagedRuleGroup\",\"excludeRules\":[{\"name\":\"NoUserAgent_HEADER\"}]}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[],\"defaultAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"},\"overrideCustomerWebACLAssociation\":false,\"loggingConfiguration\":{\"logDestinationConfigs\":[\"arn:aws:firehose:us-west-2:12345678912:deliverystream/aws-waf-logs-fms-admin-destination\"],\"redactedFields\":[{\"redactedFieldType\":\"SingleHeader\",\"redactedFieldValue\":\"Cookies\"},{\"redactedFieldType\":\"Method\"}]}}"</pre>In
--   the <tt>loggingConfiguration</tt>, you can specify one
--   <tt>logDestinationConfigs</tt>, you can optionally provide up to 20
--   <tt>redactedFields</tt>, and the <tt>RedactedFieldType</tt> must be
--   one of <tt>URI</tt>, <tt>QUERY_STRING</tt>, <tt>HEADER</tt>, or
--   <tt>METHOD</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>WAF Classic</tt><pre>"{\"type\": \"WAF\",
--   \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\":\"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\",
--   \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\":
--   {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example: Shared VPCs. Apply the preceding policy to resources in
--   shared VPCs as well as to those in VPCs that the account
--   owns<pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"includeSharedVPC\":true,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT\",\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}],\"securityGroupAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"}}"</pre>The
--   security group action for content audit can be <tt>ALLOW</tt> or
--   <tt>DENY</tt>. For <tt>ALLOW</tt>, all in-scope security group rules
--   must be within the allowed range of the policy's security group rules.
--   For <tt>DENY</tt>, all in-scope security group rules must not contain
--   a value or a range that matches a rule value or range in the policy
--   security group.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT\",\"deleteUnusedSecurityGroups\":true,\"coalesceRedundantSecurityGroups\":true}"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SecurityServicePolicyData'</a>,
--   <a>securityServicePolicyData_type</a> - The service that the policy is
--   using to protect the resources. This specifies the type of policy that
--   is created, either an WAF policy, a Shield Advanced policy, or a
--   security group policy. For security group policies, Firewall Manager
--   supports one security group for each common policy and for each
--   content audit policy. This is an adjustable limit that you can
--   increase by contacting Amazon Web Services Support.
newSecurityServicePolicyData :: SecurityServiceType -> SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | Details about the service that are specific to the service type, in
--   JSON format. For service type <tt>SHIELD_ADVANCED</tt>, this is an
--   empty string.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>DNS_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"DNS_FIREWALL\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-1\",\"priority\":10}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-2\",\"priority\":9911}]}"</pre>Valid
--   values for <tt>preProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 1 and 99. Valid
--   values for <tt>postProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 9901 and
--   10000.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>NETWORK_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"NETWORK_FIREWALL\",\"networkFirewallStatelessRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateless-rulegroup/rulegroup2\",\"priority\":10}],\"networkFirewallStatelessDefaultActions\":[\"aws:pass\",\"custom1\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessFragmentDefaultActions\":[\"custom2\",\"aws:pass\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessCustomActions\":[{\"actionName\":\"custom1\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension1\"}]}}},{\"actionName\":\"custom2\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension2\"}]}}}],\"networkFirewallStatefulRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateful-rulegroup/rulegroup1\"}],\"networkFirewallOrchestrationConfig\":{\"singleFirewallEndpointPerVPC\":true,\"allowedIPV4CidrList\":[\"10.24.34.0/28\"]}
--   }"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>WAFV2</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"WAFV2\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupArn\":null,\"overrideAction\":{\"type\":\"NONE\"},\"managedRuleGroupIdentifier\":{\"version\":null,\"vendorName\":\"AWS\",\"managedRuleGroupName\":\"AWSManagedRulesAmazonIpReputationList\"},\"ruleGroupType\":\"ManagedRuleGroup\",\"excludeRules\":[{\"name\":\"NoUserAgent_HEADER\"}]}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[],\"defaultAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"},\"overrideCustomerWebACLAssociation\":false,\"loggingConfiguration\":{\"logDestinationConfigs\":[\"arn:aws:firehose:us-west-2:12345678912:deliverystream/aws-waf-logs-fms-admin-destination\"],\"redactedFields\":[{\"redactedFieldType\":\"SingleHeader\",\"redactedFieldValue\":\"Cookies\"},{\"redactedFieldType\":\"Method\"}]}}"</pre>In
--   the <tt>loggingConfiguration</tt>, you can specify one
--   <tt>logDestinationConfigs</tt>, you can optionally provide up to 20
--   <tt>redactedFields</tt>, and the <tt>RedactedFieldType</tt> must be
--   one of <tt>URI</tt>, <tt>QUERY_STRING</tt>, <tt>HEADER</tt>, or
--   <tt>METHOD</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>WAF Classic</tt><pre>"{\"type\": \"WAF\",
--   \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\":\"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\",
--   \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\":
--   {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example: Shared VPCs. Apply the preceding policy to resources in
--   shared VPCs as well as to those in VPCs that the account
--   owns<pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"includeSharedVPC\":true,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT\",\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}],\"securityGroupAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"}}"</pre>The
--   security group action for content audit can be <tt>ALLOW</tt> or
--   <tt>DENY</tt>. For <tt>ALLOW</tt>, all in-scope security group rules
--   must be within the allowed range of the policy's security group rules.
--   For <tt>DENY</tt>, all in-scope security group rules must not contain
--   a value or a range that matches a rule value or range in the policy
--   security group.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT\",\"deleteUnusedSecurityGroups\":true,\"coalesceRedundantSecurityGroups\":true}"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
securityServicePolicyData_managedServiceData :: Lens' SecurityServicePolicyData (Maybe Text)

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy. For security group
--   policies, Firewall Manager supports one security group for each common
--   policy and for each content audit policy. This is an adjustable limit
--   that you can increase by contacting Amazon Web Services Support.
securityServicePolicyData_type :: Lens' SecurityServicePolicyData SecurityServiceType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.SecurityServicePolicyData.SecurityServicePolicyData


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy

-- | An Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data Policy
Policy' :: Maybe [ResourceTag] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> SecurityServicePolicyData -> Text -> Bool -> Bool -> Policy

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects.
[$sel:resourceTags:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe [ResourceTag]

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceType</tt> objects. Use this only to specify
--   multiple resource types. To specify a single resource type, use
--   <tt>ResourceType</tt>.
[$sel:resourceTypeList:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a
--   <tt>PutPolicy</tt> request, the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> in the
--   request must match the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version. To get the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version, use a <tt>GetPolicy</tt> request.
[$sel:policyUpdateToken:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to include in the policy. Specifying an OU
--   is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of
--   its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at
--   a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:includeMap:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text])

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyId:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to exclude from the policy. Specifying an
--   OU is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any
--   of its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added
--   at a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:excludeMap:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text])

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
[$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyName:Policy'] :: Policy -> Text

-- | Details about the security service that is being used to protect the
--   resources.
[$sel:securityServicePolicyData:Policy'] :: Policy -> SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. To apply this policy to multiple resource types,
--   specify a resource type of <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt> and then specify
--   the resource types in a <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt>.
--   
--   For WAF and Shield Advanced, example resource types include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:Policy'] :: Policy -> Text

-- | If set to <tt>True</tt>, resources with the tags that are specified in
--   the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array are not in scope of the policy. If set
--   to <tt>False</tt>, and the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array is not null,
--   only resources with the specified tags are in scope of the policy.
[$sel:excludeResourceTags:Policy'] :: Policy -> Bool

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
[$sel:remediationEnabled:Policy'] :: Policy -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Policy</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTags:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_resourceTags</a> - An
--   array of <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTypeList:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_resourceTypeList</a> -
--   An array of <tt>ResourceType</tt> objects. Use this only to specify
--   multiple resource types. To specify a single resource type, use
--   <tt>ResourceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyUpdateToken:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyUpdateToken</a>
--   - A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a
--   <tt>PutPolicy</tt> request, the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> in the
--   request must match the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version. To get the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version, use a <tt>GetPolicy</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeMap:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_includeMap</a> - Specifies
--   the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations organizational
--   units (OUs) to include in the policy. Specifying an OU is the
--   equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of its
--   child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at a
--   later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyId</a> - The ID of the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludeMap:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_excludeMap</a> - Specifies
--   the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations organizational
--   units (OUs) to exclude from the policy. Specifying an OU is the
--   equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of its
--   child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at a
--   later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources</a> - Indicates whether
--   Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager managed resources,
--   such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are not in use by the
--   Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall Manager doesn't delete
--   unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This option is not
--   available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyName</a> - The name of
--   the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityServicePolicyData:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_securityServicePolicyData</a> - Details about the security
--   service that is being used to protect the resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_resourceType</a> - The
--   type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is in
--   the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. To apply this policy to multiple resource types,
--   specify a resource type of <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt> and then specify
--   the resource types in a <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt>.
--   
--   For WAF and Shield Advanced, example resource types include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludeResourceTags:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_excludeResourceTags</a> - If set to <tt>True</tt>, resources
--   with the tags that are specified in the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array are
--   not in scope of the policy. If set to <tt>False</tt>, and the
--   <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array is not null, only resources with the
--   specified tags are in scope of the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationEnabled:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_remediationEnabled</a> - Indicates if the policy should be
--   automatically applied to new resources.
newPolicy :: Text -> SecurityServicePolicyData -> Text -> Bool -> Bool -> Policy

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects.
policy_resourceTags :: Lens' Policy (Maybe [ResourceTag])

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceType</tt> objects. Use this only to specify
--   multiple resource types. To specify a single resource type, use
--   <tt>ResourceType</tt>.
policy_resourceTypeList :: Lens' Policy (Maybe [Text])

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a
--   <tt>PutPolicy</tt> request, the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> in the
--   request must match the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version. To get the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version, use a <tt>GetPolicy</tt> request.
policy_policyUpdateToken :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to include in the policy. Specifying an OU
--   is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of
--   its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at
--   a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
policy_includeMap :: Lens' Policy (Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]))

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
policy_policyId :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to exclude from the policy. Specifying an
--   OU is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any
--   of its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added
--   at a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
policy_excludeMap :: Lens' Policy (Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]))

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
policy_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager policy.
policy_policyName :: Lens' Policy Text

-- | Details about the security service that is being used to protect the
--   resources.
policy_securityServicePolicyData :: Lens' Policy SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. To apply this policy to multiple resource types,
--   specify a resource type of <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt> and then specify
--   the resource types in a <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt>.
--   
--   For WAF and Shield Advanced, example resource types include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
policy_resourceType :: Lens' Policy Text

-- | If set to <tt>True</tt>, resources with the tags that are specified in
--   the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array are not in scope of the policy. If set
--   to <tt>False</tt>, and the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array is not null,
--   only resources with the specified tags are in scope of the policy.
policy_excludeResourceTags :: Lens' Policy Bool

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
policy_remediationEnabled :: Lens' Policy Bool
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Policy.Policy


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary

-- | Details of the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicySummary</a> smart constructor.
data PolicySummary
PolicySummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe SecurityServiceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> PolicySummary

-- | The name of the specified policy.
[$sel:policyName:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy.
[$sel:securityServiceType:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe SecurityServiceType

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. For WAF and Shield Advanced, examples include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
[$sel:remediationEnabled:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.
[$sel:policyArn:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the specified policy.
[$sel:policyId:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
[$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicySummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_policyName</a>
--   - The name of the specified policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityServiceType:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_securityServiceType</a> - The service that the policy
--   is using to protect the resources. This specifies the type of policy
--   that is created, either an WAF policy, a Shield Advanced policy, or a
--   security group policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_resourceType</a> - The type of resource protected by
--   or in scope of the policy. This is in the format shown in the
--   <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference</a>. For WAF and
--   Shield Advanced, examples include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationEnabled:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_remediationEnabled</a> - Indicates if the policy
--   should be automatically applied to new resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyArn:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_policyArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_policyId</a> -
--   The ID of the specified policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources</a> - Indicates
--   whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager managed
--   resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are not in
--   use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall Manager
--   doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This option
--   is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
newPolicySummary :: PolicySummary

-- | The name of the specified policy.
policySummary_policyName :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy.
policySummary_securityServiceType :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe SecurityServiceType)

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. For WAF and Shield Advanced, examples include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
policySummary_resourceType :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
policySummary_remediationEnabled :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.
policySummary_policyArn :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the specified policy.
policySummary_policyId :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
policySummary_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup

-- | Network Firewall stateful rule group, used in a
--   NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatefulRuleGroup</a> smart constructor.
data StatefulRuleGroup
StatefulRuleGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StatefulRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
[$sel:resourceId:StatefulRuleGroup'] :: StatefulRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the rule group.
[$sel:ruleGroupName:StatefulRuleGroup'] :: StatefulRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StatefulRuleGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:StatefulRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statefulRuleGroup_resourceId</a> - The resource ID of the rule
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleGroupName:StatefulRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statefulRuleGroup_ruleGroupName</a> - The name of the rule group.
newStatefulRuleGroup :: StatefulRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
statefulRuleGroup_resourceId :: Lens' StatefulRuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the rule group.
statefulRuleGroup_ruleGroupName :: Lens' StatefulRuleGroup (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup.StatefulRuleGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup.StatefulRuleGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup.StatefulRuleGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup.StatefulRuleGroup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup.StatefulRuleGroup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup.StatefulRuleGroup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatefulRuleGroup.StatefulRuleGroup


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup

-- | Network Firewall stateless rule group, used in a
--   NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatelessRuleGroup</a> smart constructor.
data StatelessRuleGroup
StatelessRuleGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> StatelessRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
[$sel:resourceId:StatelessRuleGroup'] :: StatelessRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The priority of the rule group. Network Firewall evaluates the
--   stateless rule groups in a firewall policy starting from the lowest
--   priority setting.
[$sel:priority:StatelessRuleGroup'] :: StatelessRuleGroup -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of the rule group.
[$sel:ruleGroupName:StatelessRuleGroup'] :: StatelessRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StatelessRuleGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:StatelessRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statelessRuleGroup_resourceId</a> - The resource ID of the rule
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:StatelessRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statelessRuleGroup_priority</a> - The priority of the rule group.
--   Network Firewall evaluates the stateless rule groups in a firewall
--   policy starting from the lowest priority setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleGroupName:StatelessRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statelessRuleGroup_ruleGroupName</a> - The name of the rule group.
newStatelessRuleGroup :: StatelessRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
statelessRuleGroup_resourceId :: Lens' StatelessRuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The priority of the rule group. Network Firewall evaluates the
--   stateless rule groups in a firewall policy starting from the lowest
--   priority setting.
statelessRuleGroup_priority :: Lens' StatelessRuleGroup (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the rule group.
statelessRuleGroup_ruleGroupName :: Lens' StatelessRuleGroup (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup.StatelessRuleGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup.StatelessRuleGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup.StatelessRuleGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup.StatelessRuleGroup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup.StatelessRuleGroup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup.StatelessRuleGroup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.StatelessRuleGroup.StatelessRuleGroup


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | The definition of the Network Firewall firewall policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallPolicyDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription' :: Maybe [StatelessRuleGroup] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [StatefulRuleGroup] -> Maybe [Text] -> NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | The stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
[$sel:statelessRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [StatelessRuleGroup]

-- | The actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless
--   rule groups.
[$sel:statelessDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the
--   stateless rule groups.
[$sel:statelessFragmentDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The stateful rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
[$sel:statefulRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [StatefulRuleGroup]

-- | Names of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless
--   default actions settings.
[$sel:statelessCustomActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessRuleGroups</a> - The
--   stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall firewall
--   policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessDefaultActions</a> - The
--   actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless rule
--   groups.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessFragmentDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessFragmentDefaultActions</a>
--   - The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the
--   stateless rule groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statefulRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statefulRuleGroups</a> - The
--   stateful rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall firewall
--   policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessCustomActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessCustomActions</a> - Names
--   of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless default
--   actions settings.
newNetworkFirewallPolicyDescription :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | The stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessRuleGroups :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [StatelessRuleGroup])

-- | The actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless
--   rule groups.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessDefaultActions :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the
--   stateless rule groups.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessFragmentDefaultActions :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The stateful rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statefulRuleGroups :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [StatefulRuleGroup])

-- | Names of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless
--   default actions settings.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessCustomActions :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation

-- | Violation detail for Network Firewall for a firewall policy that has a
--   different NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription than is required by the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation' :: Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation

-- | The policy that's currently in use in the individual account.
[$sel:currentPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
[$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The policy that should be in use in the individual account in order to
--   be compliant.
[$sel:expectedPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_currentPolicyDescription</a>
--   - The policy that's currently in use in the individual account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_violationTarget</a> - The ID
--   of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_expectedPolicyDescription</a>
--   - The policy that should be in use in the individual account in order
--   to be compliant.
newNetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation

-- | The policy that's currently in use in the individual account.
networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_currentPolicyDescription :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation (Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription)

-- | The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy that should be in use in the individual account in order to
--   be compliant.
networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_expectedPolicyDescription :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation (Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation.NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag

-- | A collection of key:value pairs associated with an Amazon Web Services
--   resource. The key:value pair can be anything you define. Typically,
--   the tag key represents a category (such as "environment") and the tag
--   value represents a specific value within that category (such as
--   "test," "development," or "production"). You can add up to 50 tags to
--   each Amazon Web Services resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag key
--   to describe a category of information, such as "customer." Tag keys
--   are case-sensitive.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag value
--   to describe a specific value within a category, such as "companyA" or
--   "companyB." Tag values are case-sensitive.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Part of the key:value pair that
--   defines a tag. You can use a tag key to describe a category of
--   information, such as "customer." Tag keys are case-sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Part of the key:value pair
--   that defines a tag. You can use a tag value to describe a specific
--   value within a category, such as "companyA" or "companyB." Tag values
--   are case-sensitive.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag key
--   to describe a category of information, such as "customer." Tag keys
--   are case-sensitive.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag value
--   to describe a specific value within a category, such as "companyA" or
--   "companyB." Tag values are case-sensitive.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType
newtype TargetType
TargetType' :: Text -> TargetType
[fromTargetType] :: TargetType -> Text
pattern TargetType_CARRIER_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_EGRESS_ONLY_INTERNET_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_INSTANCE :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_LOCAL_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_NAT_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_NETWORK_INTERFACE :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_TRANSIT_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_VPC_ENDPOINT :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_VPC_PEERING_CONNECTION :: TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.TargetType.TargetType


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route

-- | Describes a route in a route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoute</a> smart constructor.
data Route
Route' :: Maybe DestinationType -> Maybe TargetType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Route

-- | The type of destination for the route.
[$sel:destinationType:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe DestinationType

-- | The type of target for the route.
[$sel:targetType:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe TargetType

-- | The destination of the route.
[$sel:destination:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe Text

-- | The route's target.
[$sel:target:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Route</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationType:Route'</a>, <a>route_destinationType</a> - The
--   type of destination for the route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:Route'</a>, <a>route_targetType</a> - The type of
--   target for the route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:Route'</a>, <a>route_destination</a> - The
--   destination of the route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:Route'</a>, <a>route_target</a> - The route's target.
newRoute :: Route

-- | The type of destination for the route.
route_destinationType :: Lens' Route (Maybe DestinationType)

-- | The type of target for the route.
route_targetType :: Lens' Route (Maybe TargetType)

-- | The destination of the route.
route_destination :: Lens' Route (Maybe Text)

-- | The route's target.
route_target :: Lens' Route (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route.Route
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route.Route
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route.Route
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route.Route
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route.Route
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route.Route
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.Route.Route


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for an unexpected gateway route thats present in a
--   route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation</a>
--   smart constructor.
data NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Route] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation

-- | Information about the route table.
[$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The routes that are in violation.
[$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe [Route]

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the gateway ID.
[$sel:gatewayId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_routeTableId</a> -
--   Information about the route table.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes</a>
--   - The routes that are in violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_vpcId</a> -
--   Information about the VPC ID.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_gatewayId</a> -
--   Information about the gateway ID.
newNetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation

-- | Information about the route table.
networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_routeTableId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The routes that are in violation.
networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe [Route])

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the gateway ID.
networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_gatewayId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for an unexpected route that's present in a route
--   table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation</a>
--   smart constructor.
data NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation
NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Route] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

-- | The endpoint of the firewall.
[$sel:firewallEndpoint:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the route table.
[$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The routes that are in violation.
[$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe [Route]

-- | The subnet ID for the firewall.
[$sel:firewallSubnetId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:firewallEndpoint:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallEndpoint</a>
--   - The endpoint of the firewall.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_routeTableId</a> -
--   The ID of the route table.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes</a>
--   - The routes that are in violation.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:firewallSubnetId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallSubnetId</a>
--   - The subnet ID for the firewall.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_vpcId</a> -
--   Information about the VPC ID.
newNetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

-- | The endpoint of the firewall.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallEndpoint :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the route table.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_routeTableId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The routes that are in violation.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe [Route])

-- | The subnet ID for the firewall.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallSubnetId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation.NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation

-- | Violation detail for the improperly configured subnet route. It's
--   possible there is a missing route table route, or a configuration that
--   causes traffic to cross an Availability Zone boundary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i>
--   <a>newNetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation
NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation' :: Maybe [ExpectedRoute] -> Maybe [ExpectedRoute] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Route] -> Maybe [Route] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Route -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation

-- | The expected routes for the internet gateway.
[$sel:expectedInternetGatewayRoutes:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe [ExpectedRoute]

-- | The firewall subnet routes that are expected.
[$sel:expectedFirewallSubnetRoutes:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe [ExpectedRoute]

-- | The actual subnet ID for the firewall.
[$sel:actualFirewallSubnetId:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about whether the route table is used in another
--   Availability Zone.
[$sel:isRouteTableUsedInDifferentAZ:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Bool

-- | The actual firewall endpoint.
[$sel:actualFirewallEndpoint:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The subnet route table for the current firewall.
[$sel:currentFirewallSubnetRouteTable:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The route table for the current internet gateway.
[$sel:currentInternetGatewayRouteTable:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The route table ID.
[$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The actual internet gateway routes.
[$sel:actualInternetGatewayRoutes:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe [Route]

-- | The actual firewall subnet routes that are expected.
[$sel:actualFirewallSubnetRoutes:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe [Route]

-- | The internet gateway ID.
[$sel:internetGatewayId:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The expected subnet ID for the firewall.
[$sel:expectedFirewallSubnetId:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The firewall endpoint that's expected.
[$sel:expectedFirewallEndpoint:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The route that's in violation.
[$sel:violatingRoute:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Route

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The subnets that are affected.
[$sel:affectedSubnets:NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe [Text]
