module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation

-- | Violation detail for an internet gateway route with an inactive state
--   in the customer subnet route table or Network Firewall subnet route
--   table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation</a>
--   smart constructor.
data NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation
NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Route] -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation

-- | The subnet that has an inactive state.
[$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the route table ID.
[$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the route or routes that are in violation.
[$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation -> Maybe [Route]

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_violationTarget</a>
--   - The subnet that has an inactive state.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_routeTableId</a> -
--   Information about the route table ID.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_violatingRoutes</a>
--   - Information about the route or routes that are in violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_vpcId</a> -
--   Information about the VPC ID.
newNetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation :: NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation

-- | The subnet that has an inactive state.
networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the route table ID.
networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_routeTableId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the route or routes that are in violation.
networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_violatingRoutes :: Lens' NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation (Maybe [Route])

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation.NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ResourceViolation

-- | Violation detail based on resource type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceViolation</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceViolation
ResourceViolation' :: Maybe NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation -> Maybe PossibleRemediationActions -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation -> Maybe DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2InstanceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> ResourceViolation
[$sel:networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation

-- | A list of possible remediation action lists. Each individual possible
--   remediation action is a list of individual remediation actions.
[$sel:possibleRemediationActions:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe PossibleRemediationActions

-- | Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that the VPC
--   reached the limit for associated DNS Firewall rule groups. Firewall
--   Manager tried to associate another rule group with the VPC and failed.
[$sel:dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation

-- | The route configuration is invalid.
[$sel:networkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that an
--   Availability Zone is missing the expected Firewall Manager managed
--   subnet.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation

-- | Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that a rule
--   group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC is already
--   associated with the VPC and can't be associated again.
[$sel:dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation

-- | Violation detail for a network interface.
[$sel:awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation

-- | Violation detail for the subnet for which internet traffic hasn't been
--   inspected.
[$sel:networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   subnet is not associated with the expected Firewall Manager managed
--   route table.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation

-- | Expected routes are missing from Network Firewall.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for an EC2 instance.
[$sel:awsEc2InstanceViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2InstanceViolation

-- | There's an unexpected gateway route.
[$sel:networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   subnet has no Firewall Manager managed firewall in its VPC.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation

-- | There's an unexpected firewall route.
[$sel:networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for security groups.
[$sel:awsVPCSecurityGroupViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   firewall policy in an individual account has been modified in a way
--   that makes it noncompliant. For example, the individual account owner
--   might have deleted a rule group, changed the priority of a stateless
--   rule group, or changed a policy default action.
[$sel:networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation

-- | Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that a rule
--   group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC has the same
--   priority as a rule group that's already associated.
[$sel:dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceViolation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:possibleRemediationActions:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_possibleRemediationActions</a> - A list of
--   possible remediation action lists. Each individual possible
--   remediation action is a list of individual remediation actions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation</a> -
--   Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that the VPC
--   reached the limit for associated DNS Firewall rule groups. Firewall
--   Manager tried to associate another rule group with the VPC and failed.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation</a>
--   - The route configuration is invalid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation</a> -
--   Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that an
--   Availability Zone is missing the expected Firewall Manager managed
--   subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation</a> - Violation
--   detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that a rule group that
--   Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC is already associated
--   with the VPC and can't be associated again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation</a> - Violation
--   detail for a network interface.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation</a>
--   - Violation detail for the subnet for which internet traffic hasn't
--   been inspected.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation</a> -
--   Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   subnet is not associated with the expected Firewall Manager managed
--   route table.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation</a>
--   - Expected routes are missing from Network Firewall.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsEc2InstanceViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_awsEc2InstanceViolation</a> - Violation detail
--   for an EC2 instance.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation</a>
--   - There's an unexpected gateway route.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation</a> -
--   Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   subnet has no Firewall Manager managed firewall in its VPC.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation</a>
--   - There's an unexpected firewall route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsVPCSecurityGroupViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_awsVPCSecurityGroupViolation</a> - Violation
--   detail for security groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation</a> -
--   Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   firewall policy in an individual account has been modified in a way
--   that makes it noncompliant. For example, the individual account owner
--   might have deleted a rule group, changed the priority of a stateless
--   rule group, or changed a policy default action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation:ResourceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>resourceViolation_dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation</a> -
--   Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that a rule
--   group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC has the same
--   priority as a rule group that's already associated.
newResourceViolation :: ResourceViolation

-- | Undocumented member.
resourceViolation_networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation :: Lens' ResourceViolation (Maybe NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation)

-- | A list of possible remediation action lists. Each individual possible
--   remediation action is a list of individual remediation actions.
resourceViolation_possibleRemediationActions :: Lens' ResourceViolation (Maybe PossibleRemediationActions)

-- | Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that the VPC
--   reached the limit for associated DNS Firewall rule groups. Firewall
--   Manager tried to associate another rule group with the VPC and failed.
resourceViolation_dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation :: Lens' ResourceViolation (Maybe DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation)

--   group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC is already
--   associated with the VPC and can't be associated again.

module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail

-- | Violations for a resource based on the specified Firewall Manager
--   policy and Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newViolationDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ViolationDetail
ViolationDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> [ResourceViolation] -> ViolationDetail

-- | Brief description for the requested resource.
[$sel:resourceDescription:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects associated with the resource.
[$sel:resourceTags:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that the violation details were
--   requested for.
[$sel:policyId:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that the violation details were
--   requested for.
[$sel:memberAccount:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | The resource ID that the violation details were requested for.
[$sel:resourceId:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | The resource type that the violation details were requested for.
[$sel:resourceType:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | List of violations for the requested resource.
[$sel:resourceViolations:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> [ResourceViolation]

-- | Create a value of <a>ViolationDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceDescription:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceDescription</a> - Brief description for the
--   requested resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTags:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceTags</a> - The <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects
--   associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:ViolationDetail'</a>, <a>violationDetail_policyId</a>
--   - The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that the violation details
--   were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_memberAccount</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   that the violation details were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceId</a> - The resource ID that the violation
--   details were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceType</a> - The resource type that the
--   violation details were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceViolations:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceViolations</a> - List of violations for the
--   requested resource.
newViolationDetail :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ViolationDetail

-- | Brief description for the requested resource.
violationDetail_resourceDescription :: Lens' ViolationDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects associated with the resource.
violationDetail_resourceTags :: Lens' ViolationDetail (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that the violation details were
--   requested for.
violationDetail_policyId :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that the violation details were
--   requested for.
violationDetail_memberAccount :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | The resource ID that the violation details were requested for.
violationDetail_resourceId :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | The resource type that the violation details were requested for.
violationDetail_resourceType :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | List of violations for the requested resource.
violationDetail_resourceViolations :: Lens' ViolationDetail [ResourceViolation]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail.ViolationDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail.ViolationDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail.ViolationDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail.ViolationDetail
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail.ViolationDetail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail.ViolationDetail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationDetail.ViolationDetail


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason
newtype ViolationReason
ViolationReason' :: Text -> ViolationReason
[fromViolationReason] :: ViolationReason -> Text
pattern ViolationReason_BLACK_HOLE_ROUTE_DETECTED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_BLACK_HOLE_ROUTE_DETECTED_IN_FIREWALL_SUBNET :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_FIREWALL_SUBNET_MISSING_EXPECTED_ROUTE :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_FMS_CREATED_SECURITY_GROUP_EDITED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_INTERNET_GATEWAY_MISSING_EXPECTED_ROUTE :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_INTERNET_TRAFFIC_NOT_INSPECTED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_INVALID_ROUTE_CONFIGURATION :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_EXPECTED_ROUTE_TABLE :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_FIREWALL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_FIREWALL_SUBNET_IN_AZ :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_TARGET_GATEWAY :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_NETWORK_FIREWALL_POLICY_MODIFIED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_INCORRECT_WEB_ACL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_DNS_FIREWALL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_SECURITY_GROUP :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_SHIELD_PROTECTION :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_WEB_ACL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_WEB_ACL_OR_SHIELD_PROTECTION :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_VIOLATES_AUDIT_SECURITY_GROUP :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_SECURITY_GROUP_REDUNDANT :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_SECURITY_GROUP_UNUSED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_TRAFFIC_INSPECTION_CROSSES_AZ_BOUNDARY :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_UNEXPECTED_FIREWALL_ROUTES :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_UNEXPECTED_TARGET_GATEWAY_ROUTES :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_WEB_ACL_MISSING_RULE_GROUP :: ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ViolationReason.ViolationReason


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator

-- | Details of the resource that is not protected by the policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newComplianceViolator</a> smart constructor.
data ComplianceViolator
ComplianceViolator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ViolationReason -> ComplianceViolator

-- | The resource ID.
[$sel:resourceId:ComplianceViolator'] :: ComplianceViolator -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource type. This is in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web
--   Services Resource Types Reference</a>. For example:
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>, or
--   <tt>AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:ComplianceViolator'] :: ComplianceViolator -> Maybe Text

-- | The reason that the resource is not protected by the policy.
[$sel:violationReason:ComplianceViolator'] :: ComplianceViolator -> Maybe ViolationReason

-- | Create a value of <a>ComplianceViolator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ComplianceViolator'</a>,
--   <a>complianceViolator_resourceId</a> - The resource ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ComplianceViolator'</a>,
--   <a>complianceViolator_resourceType</a> - The resource type. This is in
--   the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. For example:
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>, or
--   <tt>AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationReason:ComplianceViolator'</a>,
--   <a>complianceViolator_violationReason</a> - The reason that the
--   resource is not protected by the policy.
newComplianceViolator :: ComplianceViolator

-- | The resource ID.
complianceViolator_resourceId :: Lens' ComplianceViolator (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource type. This is in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web
--   Services Resource Types Reference</a>. For example:
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>, or
--   <tt>AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy</tt>.
complianceViolator_resourceType :: Lens' ComplianceViolator (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason that the resource is not protected by the policy.
complianceViolator_violationReason :: Lens' ComplianceViolator (Maybe ViolationReason)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator.ComplianceViolator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator.ComplianceViolator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator.ComplianceViolator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator.ComplianceViolator
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator.ComplianceViolator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator.ComplianceViolator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.ComplianceViolator.ComplianceViolator


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail

-- | Describes the noncompliant resources in a member account for a
--   specific Firewall Manager policy. A maximum of 100 entries are
--   displayed. If more than 100 resources are noncompliant,
--   <tt>EvaluationLimitExceeded</tt> is set to <tt>True</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyComplianceDetail</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyComplianceDetail
PolicyComplianceDetail' :: Maybe [ComplianceViolator] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> PolicyComplianceDetail

-- | An array of resources that aren't protected by the WAF or Shield
--   Advanced policy or that aren't in compliance with the security group
--   policy.
[$sel:violators:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe [ComplianceViolator]

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager
--   policy.
[$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID.
[$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates if over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
[$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config,
--   and the error message received that indicates the problem with the
--   service.
[$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text)

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A timestamp that indicates when the returned information should be
--   considered out of date.
[$sel:expiredAt:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyComplianceDetail</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violators:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_violators</a> - An array of resources that
--   aren't protected by the WAF or Shield Advanced policy or that aren't
--   in compliance with the security group policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_policyOwner</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account that created the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_memberAccount</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_evaluationLimitExceeded</a> - Indicates if
--   over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_issueInfoMap</a> - Details about problems
--   with dependent services, such as WAF or Config, and the error message
--   received that indicates the problem with the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_policyId</a> - The ID of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiredAt:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_expiredAt</a> - A timestamp that indicates
--   when the returned information should be considered out of date.
newPolicyComplianceDetail :: PolicyComplianceDetail

-- | An array of resources that aren't protected by the WAF or Shield
--   Advanced policy or that aren't in compliance with the security group
--   policy.
policyComplianceDetail_violators :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe [ComplianceViolator])

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager
--   policy.
policyComplianceDetail_policyOwner :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID.
policyComplianceDetail_memberAccount :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates if over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
policyComplianceDetail_evaluationLimitExceeded :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config,
--   and the error message received that indicates the problem with the
--   service.
policyComplianceDetail_issueInfoMap :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text))

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
policyComplianceDetail_policyId :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp that indicates when the returned information should be
--   considered out of date.
policyComplianceDetail_expiredAt :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail.PolicyComplianceDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail.PolicyComplianceDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail.PolicyComplianceDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail.PolicyComplianceDetail
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail.PolicyComplianceDetail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail.PolicyComplianceDetail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.Types.PolicyComplianceDetail.PolicyComplianceDetail


module Network.AWS.FMS.Types

-- | API version <tt>2018-01-01</tt> of the Amazon Firewall Management
--   Service SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The value of the <tt>Type</tt> parameter is invalid.
_InvalidTypeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because there was nothing to do or the operation
--   wasn't possible. For example, you might have submitted an
--   <tt>AssociateAdminAccount</tt> request for an account ID that was
--   already set as the Firewall Manager administrator. Or you might have
--   tried to access a Region that's disabled by default, and that you need
--   to enable for the Firewall Manager administrator account and for
--   Organizations before you can access it.
_InvalidOperationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because of a system problem, even though the
--   request was valid. Retry your request.
_InternalErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The parameters of the request were invalid.
_InvalidInputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation exceeds a resource limit, for example, the maximum
--   number of <tt>policy</tt> objects that you can create for an Amazon
--   Web Services account. For more information, see <a>Firewall Manager
--   Limits</a> in the <i>WAF Developer Guide</i>.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AccountRoleStatus
AccountRoleStatus' :: Text -> AccountRoleStatus
[fromAccountRoleStatus] :: AccountRoleStatus -> Text
pattern AccountRoleStatus_CREATING :: AccountRoleStatus
pattern AccountRoleStatus_DELETED :: AccountRoleStatus
pattern AccountRoleStatus_DELETING :: AccountRoleStatus
pattern AccountRoleStatus_PENDING_DELETION :: AccountRoleStatus
pattern AccountRoleStatus_READY :: AccountRoleStatus
newtype CustomerPolicyScopeIdType
CustomerPolicyScopeIdType' :: Text -> CustomerPolicyScopeIdType
[fromCustomerPolicyScopeIdType] :: CustomerPolicyScopeIdType -> Text
pattern CustomerPolicyScopeIdType_ACCOUNT :: CustomerPolicyScopeIdType
pattern CustomerPolicyScopeIdType_ORG_UNIT :: CustomerPolicyScopeIdType
newtype DependentServiceName
DependentServiceName' :: Text -> DependentServiceName
[fromDependentServiceName] :: DependentServiceName -> Text
pattern DependentServiceName_AWSCONFIG :: DependentServiceName
pattern DependentServiceName_AWSSHIELD_ADVANCED :: DependentServiceName
pattern DependentServiceName_AWSVPC :: DependentServiceName
pattern DependentServiceName_AWSWAF :: DependentServiceName
newtype DestinationType

pattern DestinationType_IPV4 :: DestinationType
pattern DestinationType_IPV6 :: DestinationType
pattern DestinationType_PREFIX_LIST :: DestinationType

pattern PolicyComplianceStatusType_NON_COMPLIANT :: PolicyComplianceStatusType

pattern RemediationActionType_MODIFY :: RemediationActionType
pattern RemediationActionType_REMOVE :: RemediationActionType
newtype SecurityServiceType
SecurityServiceType' :: Text -> SecurityServiceType
[fromSecurityServiceType] :: SecurityServiceType -> Text
pattern SecurityServiceType_DNS_FIREWALL :: SecurityServiceType
pattern SecurityServiceType_NETWORK_FIREWALL :: SecurityServiceType
pattern SecurityServiceType_SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON :: SecurityServiceType
pattern SecurityServiceType_SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT :: SecurityServiceType
pattern SecurityServiceType_SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT :: SecurityServiceType
pattern SecurityServiceType_SHIELD_ADVANCED :: SecurityServiceType
pattern SecurityServiceType_WAF :: SecurityServiceType
pattern SecurityServiceType_WAFV2 :: SecurityServiceType
newtype TargetType

pattern TargetType_CARRIER_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_EGRESS_ONLY_INTERNET_GATEWAY :: TargetType

pattern TargetType_TRANSIT_GATEWAY :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_VPC_ENDPOINT :: TargetType
pattern TargetType_VPC_PEERING_CONNECTION :: TargetType
newtype ViolationReason
ViolationReason' :: Text -> ViolationReason
[fromViolationReason] :: ViolationReason -> Text
pattern ViolationReason_BLACK_HOLE_ROUTE_DETECTED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_BLACK_HOLE_ROUTE_DETECTED_IN_FIREWALL_SUBNET :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_FIREWALL_SUBNET_MISSING_EXPECTED_ROUTE :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_FMS_CREATED_SECURITY_GROUP_EDITED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_INTERNET_GATEWAY_MISSING_EXPECTED_ROUTE :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_INTERNET_TRAFFIC_NOT_INSPECTED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_INVALID_ROUTE_CONFIGURATION :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_EXPECTED_ROUTE_TABLE :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_FIREWALL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_FIREWALL_SUBNET_IN_AZ :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_MISSING_TARGET_GATEWAY :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_NETWORK_FIREWALL_POLICY_MODIFIED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_INCORRECT_WEB_ACL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_DNS_FIREWALL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_SECURITY_GROUP :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_SHIELD_PROTECTION :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_WEB_ACL :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_MISSING_WEB_ACL_OR_SHIELD_PROTECTION :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_RESOURCE_VIOLATES_AUDIT_SECURITY_GROUP :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_SECURITY_GROUP_REDUNDANT :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_SECURITY_GROUP_UNUSED :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_TRAFFIC_INSPECTION_CROSSES_AZ_BOUNDARY :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_UNEXPECTED_FIREWALL_ROUTES :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_UNEXPECTED_TARGET_GATEWAY_ROUTES :: ViolationReason
pattern ViolationReason_WEB_ACL_MISSING_RULE_GROUP :: ViolationReason

-- | Describes a remediation action target.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActionTarget</a> smart constructor.
data ActionTarget
ActionTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ActionTarget

-- | The ID of the remediation target.
[$sel:resourceId:ActionTarget'] :: ActionTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the remediation action target.
[$sel:description:ActionTarget'] :: ActionTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActionTarget</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ActionTarget'</a>, <a>actionTarget_resourceId</a> -
--   The ID of the remediation target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ActionTarget'</a>, <a>actionTarget_description</a>
--   - A description of the remediation action target.
newActionTarget :: ActionTarget

-- | The ID of the remediation target.
actionTarget_resourceId :: Lens' ActionTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the remediation action target.
actionTarget_description :: Lens' ActionTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | An individual Firewall Manager application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApp</a> smart constructor.
data App
App' :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> App

-- | The application's name.
[$sel:appName:App'] :: App -> Text

-- | The IP protocol name or number. The name can be one of <tt>tcp</tt>,
--   <tt>udp</tt>, or <tt>icmp</tt>. For information on possible numbers,
--   see <a>Protocol Numbers</a>.
[$sel:protocol:App'] :: App -> Text

-- | The application's port number, for example <tt>80</tt>.
[$sel:port:App'] :: App -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>App</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:appName:App'</a>, <a>app_appName</a> - The application's name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:App'</a>, <a>app_protocol</a> - The IP protocol name
--   or number. The name can be one of <tt>tcp</tt>, <tt>udp</tt>, or
--   <tt>icmp</tt>. For information on possible numbers, see <a>Protocol
--   Numbers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:App'</a>, <a>app_port</a> - The application's port
--   number, for example <tt>80</tt>.
newApp :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> App

-- | The application's name.
app_appName :: Lens' App Text

-- | The IP protocol name or number. The name can be one of <tt>tcp</tt>,
--   <tt>udp</tt>, or <tt>icmp</tt>. For information on possible numbers,
--   see <a>Protocol Numbers</a>.
app_protocol :: Lens' App Text

-- | The application's port number, for example <tt>80</tt>.
app_port :: Lens' App Natural

-- | An Firewall Manager applications list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAppsListData</a> smart constructor.
data AppsListData
AppsListData' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text [App]) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [App] -> AppsListData

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager applications list was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdateTime:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager applications list.
[$sel:listId:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager applications list was created.
[$sel:createTime:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A map of previous version numbers to their corresponding <tt>App</tt>
--   object arrays.
[$sel:previousAppsList:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> Maybe (HashMap Text [App])

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the list. When you update the
--   list, the update token must match the token of the current version of
--   the application list. You can retrieve the update token by getting the
--   list.
[$sel:listUpdateToken:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager applications list.
[$sel:listName:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> Text

-- | An array of applications in the Firewall Manager applications list.
[$sel:appsList:AppsListData'] :: AppsListData -> [App]

-- | Create a value of <a>AppsListData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTime:AppsListData'</a>,
--   <a>appsListData_lastUpdateTime</a> - The time that the Firewall
--   Manager applications list was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listId:AppsListData'</a>, <a>appsListData_listId</a> - The ID
--   of the Firewall Manager applications list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTime:AppsListData'</a>, <a>appsListData_createTime</a> -
--   The time that the Firewall Manager applications list was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previousAppsList:AppsListData'</a>,
--   <a>appsListData_previousAppsList</a> - A map of previous version
--   numbers to their corresponding <tt>App</tt> object arrays.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listUpdateToken:AppsListData'</a>,
--   <a>appsListData_listUpdateToken</a> - A unique identifier for each
--   update to the list. When you update the list, the update token must
--   match the token of the current version of the application list. You
--   can retrieve the update token by getting the list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listName:AppsListData'</a>, <a>appsListData_listName</a> - The
--   name of the Firewall Manager applications list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appsList:AppsListData'</a>, <a>appsListData_appsList</a> - An
--   array of applications in the Firewall Manager applications list.
newAppsListData :: Text -> AppsListData

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager applications list was last updated.
appsListData_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' AppsListData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager applications list.
appsListData_listId :: Lens' AppsListData (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager applications list was created.
appsListData_createTime :: Lens' AppsListData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of previous version numbers to their corresponding <tt>App</tt>
--   object arrays.
appsListData_previousAppsList :: Lens' AppsListData (Maybe (HashMap Text [App]))

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the list. When you update the
--   list, the update token must match the token of the current version of
--   the application list. You can retrieve the update token by getting the
--   list.
appsListData_listUpdateToken :: Lens' AppsListData (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager applications list.
appsListData_listName :: Lens' AppsListData Text

-- | An array of applications in the Firewall Manager applications list.
appsListData_appsList :: Lens' AppsListData [App]

-- | Details of the Firewall Manager applications list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAppsListDataSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AppsListDataSummary
AppsListDataSummary' :: Maybe [App] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AppsListDataSummary

-- | An array of <tt>App</tt> objects in the Firewall Manager applications
--   list.
[$sel:appsList:AppsListDataSummary'] :: AppsListDataSummary -> Maybe [App]

-- | The name of the applications list.

-- | The ID of the applications list.
[$sel:listId:AppsListDataSummary'] :: AppsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

[$sel:listArn:AppsListDataSummary'] :: AppsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AppsListDataSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   in the Firewall Manager applications list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listName:AppsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>appsListDataSummary_listName</a> - The name of the applications
--   list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listId:AppsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>appsListDataSummary_listId</a> - The ID of the applications list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listArn:AppsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>appsListDataSummary_listArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the applications list.
newAppsListDataSummary :: AppsListDataSummary

--   list.

-- | The name of the applications list.

-- | The ID of the applications list.
appsListDataSummary_listId :: Lens' AppsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the applications list.
appsListDataSummary_listArn :: Lens' AppsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Violation detail for an EC2 instance resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsEc2InstanceViolation</a> smart constructor.
data AwsEc2InstanceViolation
AwsEc2InstanceViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation] -> AwsEc2InstanceViolation

-- | The resource ID of the EC2 instance.
[$sel:violationTarget:AwsEc2InstanceViolation'] :: AwsEc2InstanceViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Violation detail for network interfaces associated with the EC2
--   instance.
[$sel:awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolations:AwsEc2InstanceViolation'] :: AwsEc2InstanceViolation -> Maybe [AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation]

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsEc2InstanceViolation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:AwsEc2InstanceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>awsEc2InstanceViolation_violationTarget</a> - The resource ID of
--   the EC2 instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolations:AwsEc2InstanceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>awsEc2InstanceViolation_awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolations</a> -
--   Violation detail for network interfaces associated with the EC2
--   instance.
newAwsEc2InstanceViolation :: AwsEc2InstanceViolation

-- | The resource ID of the EC2 instance.
awsEc2InstanceViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' AwsEc2InstanceViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Violation detail for network interfaces associated with the EC2
--   instance.
awsEc2InstanceViolation_awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolations :: Lens' AwsEc2InstanceViolation (Maybe [AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation])

-- | Violation detail for network interfaces associated with an EC2
--   instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation
AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation

-- | The resource ID of the network interface.
[$sel:violationTarget:AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation'] :: AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | List of security groups that violate the rules specified in the
--   primary security group of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:violatingSecurityGroups:AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation'] :: AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation_violationTarget</a> - The resource
--   ID of the network interface.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatingSecurityGroups:AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation'</a>,
--   <a>awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation_violatingSecurityGroups</a> - List
--   of security groups that violate the rules specified in the primary
--   security group of the Firewall Manager policy.
newAwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation :: AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation

-- | The resource ID of the network interface.
awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | List of security groups that violate the rules specified in the
--   primary security group of the Firewall Manager policy.
awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation_violatingSecurityGroups :: Lens' AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation (Maybe [Text])

-- | Violation detail for the rule violation in a security group when
--   compared to the primary security group of the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation</a> smart constructor.
data AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation
AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation' :: Maybe [SecurityGroupRemediationAction] -> Maybe [PartialMatch] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation

--   <tt>ViolationTarget</tt>.
[$sel:possibleSecurityGroupRemediationActions:AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation'] :: AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation -> Maybe [SecurityGroupRemediationAction]

--   policy that partially match the <tt>ViolationTarget</tt> rule.

[$sel:violationTarget:AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation'] :: AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the security group that violates the policy.

-- | Details of the resource that is not protected by the policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newComplianceViolator</a> smart constructor.
data ComplianceViolator

-- | The resource ID.
[$sel:resourceId:ComplianceViolator'] :: ComplianceViolator -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource type. This is in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web
--   Services Resource Types Reference</a>. For example:
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>, or
--   <tt>AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy</tt>.

--   the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. For example:
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>, or

-- | A DNS Firewall rule group that Firewall Manager tried to associate

-- | The VPC that Firewall Manager was applying a DNS Fireall policy to
--   reached the limit for associated DNS Firewall rule groups. Firewall
--   Manager tried to associate another rule group with the VPC and failed
--   due to the limit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | A rule group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC has
--   the same priority as a rule group that's already associated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation
DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Natural] -> Maybe Text -> DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:violationTarget:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The priority setting of the two conflicting rule groups.
[$sel:conflictingPriority:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe Natural

-- | A description of the violation that specifies the VPC and the rule
--   group that's already associated with it.
[$sel:violationTargetDescription:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The priorities of rule groups that are already associated with the
--   VPC. To retry your operation, choose priority settings that aren't in
--   this list for the rule groups in your new DNS Firewall policy.
[$sel:unavailablePriorities:DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation'] :: DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> Maybe [Natural]

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager DNS Firewall policy that was already
--   applied to the VPC. This policy contains the rule group that's already
--   associated with the VPC.

--   all optional fields omitted.

-- | Describes the compliance status for the account. An account is
--   considered noncompliant if it includes resources that are not
--   protected by the specified policy or that don't comply with the
--   policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvaluationResult</a> smart constructor.
data EvaluationResult
EvaluationResult' :: Maybe PolicyComplianceStatusType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> EvaluationResult

-- | Describes an Amazon Web Services account's compliance with the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:complianceStatus:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe PolicyComplianceStatusType

-- | Indicates that over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
[$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of resources that are noncompliant with the specified
--   policy. For WAF and Shield Advanced policies, a resource is considered
--   noncompliant if it is not associated with the policy. For security
--   group policies, a resource is considered noncompliant if it doesn't
--   comply with the rules of the policy and remediation is disabled or not
--   possible.
[$sel:violatorCount:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>EvaluationResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceStatus:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_complianceStatus</a> - Describes an Amazon Web
--   Services account's compliance with the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evaluationLimitExceeded</a> - Indicates that over
--   100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatorCount:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_violatorCount</a> - The number of resources that
--   are noncompliant with the specified policy. For WAF and Shield
--   Advanced policies, a resource is considered noncompliant if it is not
--   associated with the policy. For security group policies, a resource is
--   considered noncompliant if it doesn't comply with the rules of the
--   policy and remediation is disabled or not possible.
newEvaluationResult :: EvaluationResult

-- | Describes an Amazon Web Services account's compliance with the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
evaluationResult_complianceStatus :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe PolicyComplianceStatusType)

-- | Indicates that over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
evaluationResult_evaluationLimitExceeded :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of resources that are noncompliant with the specified
--   policy. For WAF and Shield Advanced policies, a resource is considered
--   noncompliant if it is not associated with the policy. For security
--   group policies, a resource is considered noncompliant if it doesn't
--   comply with the rules of the policy and remediation is disabled or not
--   possible.
evaluationResult_violatorCount :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe Natural)

-- | Information about the expected route in the route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExpectedRoute</a> smart constructor.
data ExpectedRoute

[$sel:ipV4Cidr:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the IPv6 CIDR block.
[$sel:ipV6Cidr:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

[$sel:allowedTargets:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe [Text]

[$sel:routeTableId:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

[$sel:prefixListId:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe Text

[$sel:contributingSubnets:ExpectedRoute'] :: ExpectedRoute -> Maybe [Text]

newNetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation :: NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation

networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation_expectedInternetGatewayRoutes :: Lens' NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation (Maybe [ExpectedRoute])

--   Availability Zone.

networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation_violatingRoutes :: Lens' NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation (Maybe [Route])

networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation_expectedFirewallEndpoint :: Lens' NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation (Maybe Text)

networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Violation detail for the improperly configured subnet route. It's
--   possible there is a missing route table route, or a configuration that
--   causes traffic to cross an Availability Zone boundary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i>
--   <a>newNetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | The definition of the Network Firewall firewall policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallPolicyDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription
NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription' :: Maybe [StatelessRuleGroup] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [StatefulRuleGroup] -> Maybe [Text] -> NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | The stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
[$sel:statelessRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [StatelessRuleGroup]

-- | The actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless
--   rule groups.
[$sel:statelessDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the
--   stateless rule groups.
[$sel:statelessFragmentDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The stateful rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
[$sel:statefulRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [StatefulRuleGroup]

-- | Names of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless
--   default actions settings.
[$sel:statelessCustomActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessRuleGroups</a> - The
--   stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall firewall
--   policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessDefaultActions</a> - The
--   actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless rule
--   groups.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessFragmentDefaultActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessFragmentDefaultActions</a>
--   - The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the
--   stateless rule groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statefulRuleGroups:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statefulRuleGroups</a> - The
--   stateful rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall firewall
--   policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statelessCustomActions:NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessCustomActions</a> - Names
--   of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless default
--   actions settings.
newNetworkFirewallPolicyDescription :: NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | The stateless rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessRuleGroups :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [StatelessRuleGroup])

-- | The actions to take on packets that don't match any of the stateless
--   rule groups.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessDefaultActions :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The actions to take on packet fragments that don't match any of the
--   stateless rule groups.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessFragmentDefaultActions :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The stateful rule groups that are used in the Network Firewall
--   firewall policy.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statefulRuleGroups :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [StatefulRuleGroup])

-- | Names of custom actions that are available for use in the stateless
--   default actions settings.
networkFirewallPolicyDescription_statelessCustomActions :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | Violation detail for Network Firewall for a firewall policy that has a
--   different NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription than is required by the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation
NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation' :: Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription -> NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation

-- | The policy that's currently in use in the individual account.
[$sel:currentPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
[$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The policy that should be in use in the individual account in order to
--   be compliant.
[$sel:expectedPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_currentPolicyDescription</a>
--   - The policy that's currently in use in the individual account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationTarget:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_violationTarget</a> - The ID
--   of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedPolicyDescription:NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_expectedPolicyDescription</a>
--   - The policy that should be in use in the individual account in order
--   to be compliant.
newNetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation :: NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation

-- | The policy that's currently in use in the individual account.
networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_currentPolicyDescription :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation (Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription)

-- | The ID of the Network Firewall or VPC resource that's in violation.
networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_violationTarget :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy that should be in use in the individual account in order to
--   be compliant.
networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation_expectedPolicyDescription :: Lens' NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation (Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription)

-- | Violation detail for an unexpected route that's present in a route
--   table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation</a>
--   smart constructor.
data NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation
NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Route] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

-- | The endpoint of the firewall.
[$sel:firewallEndpoint:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the route table.
[$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The routes that are in violation.
[$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe [Route]

-- | The subnet ID for the firewall.
[$sel:firewallSubnetId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
[$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:firewallEndpoint:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallEndpoint</a>
--   - The endpoint of the firewall.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_routeTableId</a> -
--   The ID of the route table.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes</a>
--   - The routes that are in violation.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:firewallSubnetId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallSubnetId</a>
--   - The subnet ID for the firewall.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_vpcId</a> -
--   Information about the VPC ID.
newNetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

-- | The endpoint of the firewall.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallEndpoint :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the route table.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_routeTableId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The routes that are in violation.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe [Route])

-- | The subnet ID for the firewall.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_firewallSubnetId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the VPC ID.
networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Violation detail for an unexpected gateway route thats present in a
--   route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation</a>
--   smart constructor.
data NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation
NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Route] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation

-- | Information about the route table.
[$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The routes that are in violation.
[$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe [Route]

[$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the gateway ID.
[$sel:gatewayId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'] :: NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:routeTableId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_routeTableId</a> -
--   Information about the route table.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:violatingRoutes:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes</a>
--   - The routes that are in violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation'</a>,
--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_vpcId</a> -
--   Information about the VPC ID.

--   <a>networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_gatewayId</a> -
--   Information about the gateway ID.

networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_routeTableId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_violatingRoutes :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe [Route])
