networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the gateway ID.
networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation_gatewayId :: Lens' NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The reference rule that partially matches the <tt>ViolationTarget</tt>
--   rule and violation reason.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPartialMatch</a> smart constructor.
data PartialMatch
PartialMatch' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> PartialMatch

-- | The violation reason.
[$sel:targetViolationReasons:PartialMatch'] :: PartialMatch -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The reference rule from the primary security group of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
[$sel:reference:PartialMatch'] :: PartialMatch -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PartialMatch</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetViolationReasons:PartialMatch'</a>,
--   <a>partialMatch_targetViolationReasons</a> - The violation reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reference:PartialMatch'</a>, <a>partialMatch_reference</a> -
--   The reference rule from the primary security group of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
newPartialMatch :: PartialMatch

-- | The violation reason.
partialMatch_targetViolationReasons :: Lens' PartialMatch (Maybe [Text])

-- | The reference rule from the primary security group of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
partialMatch_reference :: Lens' PartialMatch (Maybe Text)

-- | An Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data Policy
Policy' :: Maybe [ResourceTag] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> SecurityServicePolicyData -> Text -> Bool -> Bool -> Policy

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects.
[$sel:resourceTags:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe [ResourceTag]

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceType</tt> objects. Use this only to specify
--   multiple resource types. To specify a single resource type, use
--   <tt>ResourceType</tt>.
[$sel:resourceTypeList:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a
--   <tt>PutPolicy</tt> request, the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> in the
--   request must match the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version. To get the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version, use a <tt>GetPolicy</tt> request.
[$sel:policyUpdateToken:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to include in the policy. Specifying an OU
--   is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of
--   its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at
--   a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:includeMap:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text])

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyId:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to exclude from the policy. Specifying an
--   OU is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any
--   of its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added
--   at a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:excludeMap:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text])

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
[$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyName:Policy'] :: Policy -> Text

-- | Details about the security service that is being used to protect the
--   resources.
[$sel:securityServicePolicyData:Policy'] :: Policy -> SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. To apply this policy to multiple resource types,
--   specify a resource type of <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt> and then specify
--   the resource types in a <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt>.
--   
--   For WAF and Shield Advanced, example resource types include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:Policy'] :: Policy -> Text

-- | If set to <tt>True</tt>, resources with the tags that are specified in
--   the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array are not in scope of the policy. If set
--   to <tt>False</tt>, and the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array is not null,
--   only resources with the specified tags are in scope of the policy.
[$sel:excludeResourceTags:Policy'] :: Policy -> Bool

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
[$sel:remediationEnabled:Policy'] :: Policy -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Policy</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTags:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_resourceTags</a> - An
--   array of <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTypeList:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_resourceTypeList</a> -
--   An array of <tt>ResourceType</tt> objects. Use this only to specify
--   multiple resource types. To specify a single resource type, use
--   <tt>ResourceType</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyUpdateToken:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyUpdateToken</a>
--   - A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a
--   <tt>PutPolicy</tt> request, the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> in the
--   request must match the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version. To get the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version, use a <tt>GetPolicy</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeMap:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_includeMap</a> - Specifies
--   the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations organizational
--   units (OUs) to include in the policy. Specifying an OU is the
--   equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of its
--   child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at a
--   later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyId</a> - The ID of the
--   Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludeMap:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_excludeMap</a> - Specifies
--   the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations organizational
--   units (OUs) to exclude from the policy. Specifying an OU is the
--   equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of its
--   child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at a
--   later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources</a> - Indicates whether
--   Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager managed resources,
--   such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are not in use by the
--   Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall Manager doesn't delete
--   unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This option is not
--   available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyName</a> - The name of
--   the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityServicePolicyData:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_securityServicePolicyData</a> - Details about the security
--   service that is being used to protect the resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_resourceType</a> - The
--   type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is in
--   the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. To apply this policy to multiple resource types,
--   specify a resource type of <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt> and then specify
--   the resource types in a <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt>.
--   
--   For WAF and Shield Advanced, example resource types include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludeResourceTags:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_excludeResourceTags</a> - If set to <tt>True</tt>, resources
--   with the tags that are specified in the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array are
--   not in scope of the policy. If set to <tt>False</tt>, and the
--   <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array is not null, only resources with the
--   specified tags are in scope of the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationEnabled:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_remediationEnabled</a> - Indicates if the policy should be
--   automatically applied to new resources.
newPolicy :: Text -> SecurityServicePolicyData -> Text -> Bool -> Bool -> Policy

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects.
policy_resourceTags :: Lens' Policy (Maybe [ResourceTag])

-- | An array of <tt>ResourceType</tt> objects. Use this only to specify
--   multiple resource types. To specify a single resource type, use
--   <tt>ResourceType</tt>.
policy_resourceTypeList :: Lens' Policy (Maybe [Text])

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a
--   <tt>PutPolicy</tt> request, the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> in the
--   request must match the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version. To get the <tt>PolicyUpdateToken</tt> of the current
--   policy version, use a <tt>GetPolicy</tt> request.
policy_policyUpdateToken :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to include in the policy. Specifying an OU
--   is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of
--   its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at
--   a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
policy_includeMap :: Lens' Policy (Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]))

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
policy_policyId :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations
--   organizational units (OUs) to exclude from the policy. Specifying an
--   OU is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any
--   of its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added
--   at a later time.
--   
--   You can specify inclusions or exclusions, but not both. If you specify
--   an <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts specified by the <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, and does not evaluate
--   any <tt>ExcludeMap</tt> specifications. If you do not specify an
--   <tt>IncludeMap</tt>, then Firewall Manager applies the policy to all
--   accounts except for those specified by the <tt>ExcludeMap</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify account IDs, OUs, or a combination:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify account IDs by setting the key to <tt>ACCOUNT</tt>. For
--   example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT : [accountID1,
--   accountID2]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify OUs by setting the key to <tt>ORG_UNIT</tt>. For example,
--   the following is a valid map: <tt>{ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with
--   a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: <tt>{ACCOUNT :
--   [accountID1, accountID2], ORG_UNIT : [ouid111,
--   ouid112]}</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
policy_excludeMap :: Lens' Policy (Maybe (HashMap CustomerPolicyScopeIdType [Text]))

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
policy_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager policy.
policy_policyName :: Lens' Policy Text

-- | Details about the security service that is being used to protect the
--   resources.
policy_securityServicePolicyData :: Lens' Policy SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. To apply this policy to multiple resource types,
--   specify a resource type of <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt> and then specify
--   the resource types in a <tt>ResourceTypeList</tt>.
--   
--   For WAF and Shield Advanced, example resource types include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
policy_resourceType :: Lens' Policy Text

-- | If set to <tt>True</tt>, resources with the tags that are specified in
--   the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array are not in scope of the policy. If set
--   to <tt>False</tt>, and the <tt>ResourceTag</tt> array is not null,
--   only resources with the specified tags are in scope of the policy.
policy_excludeResourceTags :: Lens' Policy Bool

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
policy_remediationEnabled :: Lens' Policy Bool

-- | Describes the noncompliant resources in a member account for a
--   specific Firewall Manager policy. A maximum of 100 entries are
--   displayed. If more than 100 resources are noncompliant,
--   <tt>EvaluationLimitExceeded</tt> is set to <tt>True</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyComplianceDetail</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyComplianceDetail
PolicyComplianceDetail' :: Maybe [ComplianceViolator] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> PolicyComplianceDetail

-- | An array of resources that aren't protected by the WAF or Shield
--   Advanced policy or that aren't in compliance with the security group
--   policy.
[$sel:violators:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe [ComplianceViolator]

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager
--   policy.
[$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID.
[$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates if over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
[$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config,
--   and the error message received that indicates the problem with the
--   service.
[$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text)

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A timestamp that indicates when the returned information should be
--   considered out of date.
[$sel:expiredAt:PolicyComplianceDetail'] :: PolicyComplianceDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyComplianceDetail</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violators:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_violators</a> - An array of resources that
--   aren't protected by the WAF or Shield Advanced policy or that aren't
--   in compliance with the security group policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_policyOwner</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account that created the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_memberAccount</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationLimitExceeded:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_evaluationLimitExceeded</a> - Indicates if
--   over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_issueInfoMap</a> - Details about problems
--   with dependent services, such as WAF or Config, and the error message
--   received that indicates the problem with the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_policyId</a> - The ID of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiredAt:PolicyComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceDetail_expiredAt</a> - A timestamp that indicates
--   when the returned information should be considered out of date.
newPolicyComplianceDetail :: PolicyComplianceDetail

-- | An array of resources that aren't protected by the WAF or Shield
--   Advanced policy or that aren't in compliance with the security group
--   policy.
policyComplianceDetail_violators :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe [ComplianceViolator])

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager
--   policy.
policyComplianceDetail_policyOwner :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID.
policyComplianceDetail_memberAccount :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates if over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
policyComplianceDetail_evaluationLimitExceeded :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config,
--   and the error message received that indicates the problem with the
--   service.
policyComplianceDetail_issueInfoMap :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text))

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
policyComplianceDetail_policyId :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp that indicates when the returned information should be
--   considered out of date.
policyComplianceDetail_expiredAt :: Lens' PolicyComplianceDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates whether the account is compliant with the specified policy.
--   An account is considered noncompliant if it includes resources that
--   are not protected by the policy, for WAF and Shield Advanced policies,
--   or that are noncompliant with the policy, for security group policies.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyComplianceStatus</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyComplianceStatus
PolicyComplianceStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [EvaluationResult] -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text) -> Maybe Text -> PolicyComplianceStatus

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyName:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager
--   policy.
[$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The member account ID.
[$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Timestamp of the last update to the <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
[$sel:lastUpdated:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An array of <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
[$sel:evaluationResults:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe [EvaluationResult]

-- | Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config,
--   and the error message received that indicates the problem with the
--   service.
[$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe (HashMap DependentServiceName Text)

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceStatus'] :: PolicyComplianceStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyComplianceStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyOwner:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_policyOwner</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account that created the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_memberAccount</a> - The member account ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_lastUpdated</a> - Timestamp of the last
--   update to the <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationResults:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_evaluationResults</a> - An array of
--   <tt>EvaluationResult</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issueInfoMap:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_issueInfoMap</a> - Details about problems
--   with dependent services, such as WAF or Config, and the error message
--   received that indicates the problem with the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:PolicyComplianceStatus'</a>,
--   <a>policyComplianceStatus_policyId</a> - The ID of the Firewall
--   Manager policy.
newPolicyComplianceStatus :: PolicyComplianceStatus

--   policy.
policyComplianceStatus_policyOwner :: Lens' PolicyComplianceStatus (Maybe Text)

--   service.

-- | Details of the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicySummary</a> smart constructor.
data PolicySummary
PolicySummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe SecurityServiceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> PolicySummary

-- | The name of the specified policy.
[$sel:policyName:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy.
[$sel:securityServiceType:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe SecurityServiceType

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. For WAF and Shield Advanced, examples include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
[$sel:remediationEnabled:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.
[$sel:policyArn:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the specified policy.
[$sel:policyId:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
[$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicySummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_policyName</a>
--   - The name of the specified policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityServiceType:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_securityServiceType</a> - The service that the policy
--   is using to protect the resources. This specifies the type of policy
--   that is created, either an WAF policy, a Shield Advanced policy, or a
--   security group policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_resourceType</a> - The type of resource protected by
--   or in scope of the policy. This is in the format shown in the
--   <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference</a>. For WAF and
--   Shield Advanced, examples include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationEnabled:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_remediationEnabled</a> - Indicates if the policy
--   should be automatically applied to new resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyArn:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_policyArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_policyId</a> -
--   The ID of the specified policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteUnusedFMManagedResources:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources</a> - Indicates
--   whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager managed
--   resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are not in
--   use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall Manager
--   doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This option
--   is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
newPolicySummary :: PolicySummary

-- | The name of the specified policy.
policySummary_policyName :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy.
policySummary_securityServiceType :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe SecurityServiceType)

-- | The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. For WAF and Shield Advanced, examples include
--   <tt>AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFront::Distribution</tt>. For a security group common
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt> and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>. For a security group content audit
--   policy, valid values are <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>, and <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>.
--   For a security group usage audit policy, the value is
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>. For an Network Firewall policy or
--   DNS Firewall policy, the value is <tt>AWS::EC2::VPC</tt>.
policySummary_resourceType :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new
--   resources.
policySummary_remediationEnabled :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.
policySummary_policyArn :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the specified policy.
policySummary_policyId :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether Firewall Manager should delete Firewall Manager
--   managed resources, such as web ACLs and security groups, when they are
--   not in use by the Firewall Manager policy. By default, Firewall
--   Manager doesn't delete unused Firewall Manager managed resources. This
--   option is not available for Shield Advanced or WAF Classic policies.
policySummary_deleteUnusedFMManagedResources :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of remediation actions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPossibleRemediationAction</a> smart constructor.
data PossibleRemediationAction
PossibleRemediationAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> [RemediationActionWithOrder] -> PossibleRemediationAction

-- | Information about whether an action is taken by default.
[$sel:isDefaultAction:PossibleRemediationAction'] :: PossibleRemediationAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | A description of the list of remediation actions.
[$sel:description:PossibleRemediationAction'] :: PossibleRemediationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The ordered list of remediation actions.
[$sel:orderedRemediationActions:PossibleRemediationAction'] :: PossibleRemediationAction -> [RemediationActionWithOrder]

-- | Create a value of <a>PossibleRemediationAction</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultAction:PossibleRemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>possibleRemediationAction_isDefaultAction</a> - Information about
--   whether an action is taken by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:PossibleRemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>possibleRemediationAction_description</a> - A description of the
--   list of remediation actions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:orderedRemediationActions:PossibleRemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>possibleRemediationAction_orderedRemediationActions</a> - The
--   ordered list of remediation actions.
newPossibleRemediationAction :: PossibleRemediationAction

-- | Information about whether an action is taken by default.
possibleRemediationAction_isDefaultAction :: Lens' PossibleRemediationAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | A description of the list of remediation actions.
possibleRemediationAction_description :: Lens' PossibleRemediationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ordered list of remediation actions.
possibleRemediationAction_orderedRemediationActions :: Lens' PossibleRemediationAction [RemediationActionWithOrder]

-- | A list of possible remediation action lists. Each individual possible
--   remediation action is a list of individual remediation actions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPossibleRemediationActions</a> smart constructor.
data PossibleRemediationActions
PossibleRemediationActions' :: Maybe [PossibleRemediationAction] -> Maybe Text -> PossibleRemediationActions

-- | Information about the actions.
[$sel:actions:PossibleRemediationActions'] :: PossibleRemediationActions -> Maybe [PossibleRemediationAction]

-- | A description of the possible remediation actions list.
[$sel:description:PossibleRemediationActions'] :: PossibleRemediationActions -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PossibleRemediationActions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actions:PossibleRemediationActions'</a>,
--   <a>possibleRemediationActions_actions</a> - Information about the
--   actions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:PossibleRemediationActions'</a>,
--   <a>possibleRemediationActions_description</a> - A description of the
--   possible remediation actions list.
newPossibleRemediationActions :: PossibleRemediationActions

-- | Information about the actions.
possibleRemediationActions_actions :: Lens' PossibleRemediationActions (Maybe [PossibleRemediationAction])

-- | A description of the possible remediation actions list.
possibleRemediationActions_description :: Lens' PossibleRemediationActions (Maybe Text)

-- | An Firewall Manager protocols list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtocolsListData</a> smart constructor.
data ProtocolsListData
ProtocolsListData' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [Text] -> ProtocolsListData

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdateTime:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:listId:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was created.
[$sel:createTime:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A map of previous version numbers to their corresponding protocol
--   arrays.
[$sel:previousProtocolsList:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the list. When you update the
--   list, the update token must match the token of the current version of
--   the application list. You can retrieve the update token by getting the
--   list.
[$sel:listUpdateToken:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:listName:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> Text

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListData'] :: ProtocolsListData -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtocolsListData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTime:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_lastUpdateTime</a> - The time that the Firewall
--   Manager protocols list was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listId:ProtocolsListData'</a>, <a>protocolsListData_listId</a>
--   - The ID of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTime:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_createTime</a> - The time that the Firewall
--   Manager protocols list was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previousProtocolsList:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_previousProtocolsList</a> - A map of previous
--   version numbers to their corresponding protocol arrays.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listUpdateToken:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_listUpdateToken</a> - A unique identifier for
--   each update to the list. When you update the list, the update token
--   must match the token of the current version of the application list.
--   You can retrieve the update token by getting the list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listName:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_listName</a> - The name of the Firewall Manager
--   protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListData'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListData_protocolsList</a> - An array of protocols in the
--   Firewall Manager protocols list.
newProtocolsListData :: Text -> ProtocolsListData

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was last updated.
protocolsListData_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListData_listId :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the Firewall Manager protocols list was created.
protocolsListData_createTime :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of previous version numbers to their corresponding protocol
--   arrays.
protocolsListData_previousProtocolsList :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | A unique identifier for each update to the list. When you update the
--   list, the update token must match the token of the current version of
--   the application list. You can retrieve the update token by getting the
--   list.
protocolsListData_listUpdateToken :: Lens' ProtocolsListData (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListData_listName :: Lens' ProtocolsListData Text

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListData_protocolsList :: Lens' ProtocolsListData [Text]

-- | Details of the Firewall Manager protocols list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtocolsListDataSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ProtocolsListDataSummary
ProtocolsListDataSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> ProtocolsListDataSummary

-- | The name of the specified protocols list.
[$sel:listName:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the specified protocols list.
[$sel:listId:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified protocols list.
[$sel:listArn:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
[$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListDataSummary'] :: ProtocolsListDataSummary -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtocolsListDataSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:listName:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_listName</a> - The name of the specified
--   protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listId:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_listId</a> - The ID of the specified
--   protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listArn:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_listArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the specified protocols list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocolsList:ProtocolsListDataSummary'</a>,
--   <a>protocolsListDataSummary_protocolsList</a> - An array of protocols
--   in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
newProtocolsListDataSummary :: ProtocolsListDataSummary

-- | The name of the specified protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_listName :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the specified protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_listId :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_listArn :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of protocols in the Firewall Manager protocols list.
protocolsListDataSummary_protocolsList :: Lens' ProtocolsListDataSummary (Maybe [Text])

-- | Information about an individual action you can take to remediate a
--   violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemediationAction</a> smart constructor.
data RemediationAction
RemediationAction' :: Maybe EC2CreateRouteAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteAction -> Maybe EC2AssociateRouteTableAction -> Maybe EC2CreateRouteTableAction -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EC2CopyRouteTableAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction -> Maybe EC2DeleteRouteAction -> RemediationAction

-- | Information about the CreateRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2CreateRouteAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2CreateRouteAction

-- | Information about the ReplaceRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteAction

-- | Information about the AssociateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2
--   API.
[$sel:eC2AssociateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2AssociateRouteTableAction

-- | Information about the CreateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2CreateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2CreateRouteTableAction

-- | A description of a remediation action.
[$sel:description:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the CopyRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2CopyRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2CopyRouteTableAction

-- | Information about the ReplaceRouteTableAssociation action in the
--   Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction

-- | Information about the DeleteRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
[$sel:eC2DeleteRouteAction:RemediationAction'] :: RemediationAction -> Maybe EC2DeleteRouteAction

-- | Create a value of <a>RemediationAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   CreateRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteAction</a> - Information about the
--   ReplaceRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2AssociateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2AssociateRouteTableAction</a> - Information
--   about the AssociateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2CreateRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2CreateRouteTableAction</a> - Information about
--   the CreateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_description</a> - A description of a remediation
--   action.

--   <a>$sel:eC2CopyRouteTableAction:RemediationAction'</a>,

--   the CopyRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction</a> -
--   Information about the ReplaceRouteTableAssociation action in the
--   Amazon EC2 API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2DeleteRouteAction:RemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>remediationAction_eC2DeleteRouteAction</a> - Information about the
--   DeleteRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
newRemediationAction :: RemediationAction

-- | Information about the CreateRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2CreateRouteAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2CreateRouteAction)

-- | Information about the ReplaceRoute action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteAction)

--   API.
remediationAction_eC2AssociateRouteTableAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2AssociateRouteTableAction)

-- | Information about the CreateRouteTable action in the Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2CreateRouteTableAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2CreateRouteTableAction)

remediationAction_description :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe Text)

remediationAction_eC2CopyRouteTableAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2CopyRouteTableAction)

--   Amazon EC2 API.
remediationAction_eC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction :: Lens' RemediationAction (Maybe EC2ReplaceRouteTableAssociationAction)

-- | An ordered list of actions you can take to remediate a violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemediationActionWithOrder</a> smart constructor.
data RemediationActionWithOrder
RemediationActionWithOrder' :: Maybe RemediationAction -> Maybe Int -> RemediationActionWithOrder

-- | Information about an action you can take to remediate a violation.
[$sel:remediationAction:RemediationActionWithOrder'] :: RemediationActionWithOrder -> Maybe RemediationAction

-- | The order of the remediation actions in the list.
[$sel:order:RemediationActionWithOrder'] :: RemediationActionWithOrder -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RemediationActionWithOrder</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationAction:RemediationActionWithOrder'</a>,
--   <a>remediationActionWithOrder_remediationAction</a> - Information
--   about an action you can take to remediate a violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:order:RemediationActionWithOrder'</a>,
--   <a>remediationActionWithOrder_order</a> - The order of the remediation
--   actions in the list.
newRemediationActionWithOrder :: RemediationActionWithOrder

-- | Information about an action you can take to remediate a violation.
remediationActionWithOrder_remediationAction :: Lens' RemediationActionWithOrder (Maybe RemediationAction)

-- | The order of the remediation actions in the list.
remediationActionWithOrder_order :: Lens' RemediationActionWithOrder (Maybe Int)

-- | The resource tags that Firewall Manager uses to determine if a
--   particular resource should be included or excluded from the Firewall
--   Manager policy. Tags enable you to categorize your Amazon Web Services
--   resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or
--   environment. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value.
--   Firewall Manager combines the tags with "AND" so that, if you add more
--   than one tag to a policy scope, a resource must have all the specified
--   tags to be included or excluded. For more information, see <a>Working
--   with Tag Editor</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceTag</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceTag
ResourceTag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ResourceTag

-- | The resource tag value.
[$sel:value:ResourceTag'] :: ResourceTag -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource tag key.
[$sel:key:ResourceTag'] :: ResourceTag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ResourceTag'</a>, <a>resourceTag_value</a> - The
--   resource tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ResourceTag'</a>, <a>resourceTag_key</a> - The resource
--   tag key.
newResourceTag :: Text -> ResourceTag

-- | The resource tag value.
resourceTag_value :: Lens' ResourceTag (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource tag key.
resourceTag_key :: Lens' ResourceTag Text

-- | Violation detail based on resource type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceViolation</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceViolation
ResourceViolation' :: Maybe NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation -> Maybe PossibleRemediationActions -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation -> Maybe DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2InstanceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation -> Maybe AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation -> ResourceViolation
[$sel:networkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallBlackHoleRouteDetectedViolation

-- | A list of possible remediation action lists. Each individual possible
--   remediation action is a list of individual remediation actions.
[$sel:possibleRemediationActions:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe PossibleRemediationActions

-- | Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that the VPC
--   reached the limit for associated DNS Firewall rule groups. Firewall
--   Manager tried to associate another rule group with the VPC and failed.
[$sel:dnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupLimitExceededViolation

-- | The route configuration is invalid.
[$sel:networkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInvalidRouteConfigurationViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that an
--   Availability Zone is missing the expected Firewall Manager managed
--   subnet.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingSubnetViolation

-- | Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that a rule
--   group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC is already
--   associated with the VPC and can't be associated again.
[$sel:dnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe DnsDuplicateRuleGroupViolation

-- | Violation detail for a network interface.
[$sel:awsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceViolation

-- | Violation detail for the subnet for which internet traffic hasn't been
--   inspected.
[$sel:networkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallInternetTrafficNotInspectedViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   subnet is not associated with the expected Firewall Manager managed
--   route table.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRTViolation

-- | Expected routes are missing from Network Firewall.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingExpectedRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for an EC2 instance.
[$sel:awsEc2InstanceViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe AwsEc2InstanceViolation

-- | There's an unexpected gateway route.
[$sel:networkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedGatewayRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   subnet has no Firewall Manager managed firewall in its VPC.
[$sel:networkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallMissingFirewallViolation

-- | There's an unexpected firewall route.
[$sel:networkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallUnexpectedFirewallRoutesViolation

-- | Violation detail for security groups.
[$sel:awsVPCSecurityGroupViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe AwsVPCSecurityGroupViolation

-- | Violation detail for an Network Firewall policy that indicates that a
--   firewall policy in an individual account has been modified in a way
--   that makes it noncompliant. For example, the individual account owner
--   might have deleted a rule group, changed the priority of a stateless
--   rule group, or changed a policy default action.
[$sel:networkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe NetworkFirewallPolicyModifiedViolation

-- | Violation detail for a DNS Firewall policy that indicates that a rule
--   group that Firewall Manager tried to associate with a VPC has the same
--   priority as a rule group that's already associated.
[$sel:dnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation:ResourceViolation'] :: ResourceViolation -> Maybe DnsRuleGroupPriorityConflictViolation

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceViolation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--
