-- | Describes a route in a route table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoute</a> smart constructor.
data Route
Route' :: Maybe DestinationType -> Maybe TargetType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Route

-- | The type of destination for the route.
[$sel:destinationType:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe DestinationType

-- | The type of target for the route.
[$sel:targetType:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe TargetType

-- | The destination of the route.
[$sel:destination:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe Text

-- | The route's target.
[$sel:target:Route'] :: Route -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Route</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationType:Route'</a>, <a>route_destinationType</a> - The
--   type of destination for the route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:Route'</a>, <a>route_targetType</a> - The type of
--   target for the route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:Route'</a>, <a>route_destination</a> - The
--   destination of the route.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:Route'</a>, <a>route_target</a> - The route's target.
newRoute :: Route

-- | The type of destination for the route.
route_destinationType :: Lens' Route (Maybe DestinationType)

-- | The type of target for the route.
route_targetType :: Lens' Route (Maybe TargetType)

-- | The destination of the route.
route_destination :: Lens' Route (Maybe Text)

-- | The route's target.
route_target :: Lens' Route (Maybe Text)

-- | Remediation option for the rule specified in the
--   <tt>ViolationTarget</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSecurityGroupRemediationAction</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SecurityGroupRemediationAction
SecurityGroupRemediationAction' :: Maybe RemediationActionType -> Maybe SecurityGroupRuleDescription -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> SecurityGroupRemediationAction

-- | The remediation action that will be performed.
[$sel:remediationActionType:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'] :: SecurityGroupRemediationAction -> Maybe RemediationActionType

-- | The final state of the rule specified in the <tt>ViolationTarget</tt>
--   after it is remediated.
[$sel:remediationResult:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'] :: SecurityGroupRemediationAction -> Maybe SecurityGroupRuleDescription

-- | Indicates if the current action is the default action.
[$sel:isDefaultAction:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'] :: SecurityGroupRemediationAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | Brief description of the action that will be performed.
[$sel:description:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'] :: SecurityGroupRemediationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SecurityGroupRemediationAction</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationActionType:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRemediationAction_remediationActionType</a> - The
--   remediation action that will be performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:remediationResult:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRemediationAction_remediationResult</a> - The final
--   state of the rule specified in the <tt>ViolationTarget</tt> after it
--   is remediated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultAction:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRemediationAction_isDefaultAction</a> - Indicates if
--   the current action is the default action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:SecurityGroupRemediationAction'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRemediationAction_description</a> - Brief description
--   of the action that will be performed.
newSecurityGroupRemediationAction :: SecurityGroupRemediationAction

-- | The remediation action that will be performed.
securityGroupRemediationAction_remediationActionType :: Lens' SecurityGroupRemediationAction (Maybe RemediationActionType)

-- | The final state of the rule specified in the <tt>ViolationTarget</tt>
--   after it is remediated.
securityGroupRemediationAction_remediationResult :: Lens' SecurityGroupRemediationAction (Maybe SecurityGroupRuleDescription)

-- | Indicates if the current action is the default action.
securityGroupRemediationAction_isDefaultAction :: Lens' SecurityGroupRemediationAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | Brief description of the action that will be performed.
securityGroupRemediationAction_description :: Lens' SecurityGroupRemediationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a set of permissions for a security group rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSecurityGroupRuleDescription</a> smart constructor.
data SecurityGroupRuleDescription
SecurityGroupRuleDescription' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> SecurityGroupRuleDescription

-- | The start of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an
--   ICMP/ICMPv6 type number. A value of <tt>-1</tt> indicates all
--   ICMP/ICMPv6 types.
[$sel:fromPort:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'] :: SecurityGroupRuleDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The IPv4 ranges for the security group rule.
[$sel:iPV4Range:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'] :: SecurityGroupRuleDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the prefix list for the security group rule.
[$sel:prefixListId:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'] :: SecurityGroupRuleDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP protocol name (<tt>tcp</tt>, <tt>udp</tt>, <tt>icmp</tt>,
--   <tt>icmpv6</tt>) or number.
[$sel:protocol:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'] :: SecurityGroupRuleDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The IPv6 ranges for the security group rule.
[$sel:iPV6Range:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'] :: SecurityGroupRuleDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The end of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an
--   ICMP/ICMPv6 code. A value of <tt>-1</tt> indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6
--   codes.
[$sel:toPort:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'] :: SecurityGroupRuleDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>SecurityGroupRuleDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromPort:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRuleDescription_fromPort</a> - The start of the port
--   range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 type number. A
--   value of <tt>-1</tt> indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iPV4Range:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRuleDescription_iPV4Range</a> - The IPv4 ranges for
--   the security group rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefixListId:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRuleDescription_prefixListId</a> - The ID of the
--   prefix list for the security group rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRuleDescription_protocol</a> - The IP protocol name
--   (<tt>tcp</tt>, <tt>udp</tt>, <tt>icmp</tt>, <tt>icmpv6</tt>) or
--   number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iPV6Range:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRuleDescription_iPV6Range</a> - The IPv6 ranges for
--   the security group rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toPort:SecurityGroupRuleDescription'</a>,
--   <a>securityGroupRuleDescription_toPort</a> - The end of the port range
--   for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 code. A value of
--   <tt>-1</tt> indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 codes.
newSecurityGroupRuleDescription :: SecurityGroupRuleDescription

-- | The start of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an
--   ICMP/ICMPv6 type number. A value of <tt>-1</tt> indicates all
--   ICMP/ICMPv6 types.
securityGroupRuleDescription_fromPort :: Lens' SecurityGroupRuleDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The IPv4 ranges for the security group rule.
securityGroupRuleDescription_iPV4Range :: Lens' SecurityGroupRuleDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the prefix list for the security group rule.
securityGroupRuleDescription_prefixListId :: Lens' SecurityGroupRuleDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP protocol name (<tt>tcp</tt>, <tt>udp</tt>, <tt>icmp</tt>,
--   <tt>icmpv6</tt>) or number.
securityGroupRuleDescription_protocol :: Lens' SecurityGroupRuleDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The IPv6 ranges for the security group rule.
securityGroupRuleDescription_iPV6Range :: Lens' SecurityGroupRuleDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The end of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an
--   ICMP/ICMPv6 code. A value of <tt>-1</tt> indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6
--   codes.
securityGroupRuleDescription_toPort :: Lens' SecurityGroupRuleDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | Details about the security service that is being used to protect the
--   resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSecurityServicePolicyData</a> smart constructor.
data SecurityServicePolicyData
SecurityServicePolicyData' :: Maybe Text -> SecurityServiceType -> SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | Details about the service that are specific to the service type, in
--   JSON format. For service type <tt>SHIELD_ADVANCED</tt>, this is an
--   empty string.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>DNS_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"DNS_FIREWALL\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-1\",\"priority\":10}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-2\",\"priority\":9911}]}"</pre>Valid
--   values for <tt>preProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 1 and 99. Valid
--   values for <tt>postProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 9901 and
--   10000.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>NETWORK_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"NETWORK_FIREWALL\",\"networkFirewallStatelessRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateless-rulegroup/rulegroup2\",\"priority\":10}],\"networkFirewallStatelessDefaultActions\":[\"aws:pass\",\"custom1\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessFragmentDefaultActions\":[\"custom2\",\"aws:pass\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessCustomActions\":[{\"actionName\":\"custom1\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension1\"}]}}},{\"actionName\":\"custom2\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension2\"}]}}}],\"networkFirewallStatefulRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateful-rulegroup/rulegroup1\"}],\"networkFirewallOrchestrationConfig\":{\"singleFirewallEndpointPerVPC\":true,\"allowedIPV4CidrList\":[\"10.24.34.0/28\"]}
--   }"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>WAFV2</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"WAFV2\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupArn\":null,\"overrideAction\":{\"type\":\"NONE\"},\"managedRuleGroupIdentifier\":{\"version\":null,\"vendorName\":\"AWS\",\"managedRuleGroupName\":\"AWSManagedRulesAmazonIpReputationList\"},\"ruleGroupType\":\"ManagedRuleGroup\",\"excludeRules\":[{\"name\":\"NoUserAgent_HEADER\"}]}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[],\"defaultAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"},\"overrideCustomerWebACLAssociation\":false,\"loggingConfiguration\":{\"logDestinationConfigs\":[\"arn:aws:firehose:us-west-2:12345678912:deliverystream/aws-waf-logs-fms-admin-destination\"],\"redactedFields\":[{\"redactedFieldType\":\"SingleHeader\",\"redactedFieldValue\":\"Cookies\"},{\"redactedFieldType\":\"Method\"}]}}"</pre>In
--   the <tt>loggingConfiguration</tt>, you can specify one
--   <tt>logDestinationConfigs</tt>, you can optionally provide up to 20
--   <tt>redactedFields</tt>, and the <tt>RedactedFieldType</tt> must be
--   one of <tt>URI</tt>, <tt>QUERY_STRING</tt>, <tt>HEADER</tt>, or
--   <tt>METHOD</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>WAF Classic</tt><pre>"{\"type\": \"WAF\",
--   \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\":\"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\",
--   \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\":
--   {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example: Shared VPCs. Apply the preceding policy to resources in
--   shared VPCs as well as to those in VPCs that the account
--   owns<pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"includeSharedVPC\":true,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT\",\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}],\"securityGroupAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"}}"</pre>The
--   security group action for content audit can be <tt>ALLOW</tt> or
--   <tt>DENY</tt>. For <tt>ALLOW</tt>, all in-scope security group rules
--   must be within the allowed range of the policy's security group rules.
--   For <tt>DENY</tt>, all in-scope security group rules must not contain
--   a value or a range that matches a rule value or range in the policy
--   security group.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT\",\"deleteUnusedSecurityGroups\":true,\"coalesceRedundantSecurityGroups\":true}"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:managedServiceData:SecurityServicePolicyData'] :: SecurityServicePolicyData -> Maybe Text

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy. For security group
--   policies, Firewall Manager supports one security group for each common
--   policy and for each content audit policy. This is an adjustable limit
--   that you can increase by contacting Amazon Web Services Support.
[$sel:type':SecurityServicePolicyData'] :: SecurityServicePolicyData -> SecurityServiceType

-- | Create a value of <a>SecurityServicePolicyData</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedServiceData:SecurityServicePolicyData'</a>,
--   <a>securityServicePolicyData_managedServiceData</a> - Details about
--   the service that are specific to the service type, in JSON format. For
--   service type <tt>SHIELD_ADVANCED</tt>, this is an empty string.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>DNS_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"DNS_FIREWALL\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-1\",\"priority\":10}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-2\",\"priority\":9911}]}"</pre>Valid
--   values for <tt>preProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 1 and 99. Valid
--   values for <tt>postProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 9901 and
--   10000.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>NETWORK_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"NETWORK_FIREWALL\",\"networkFirewallStatelessRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateless-rulegroup/rulegroup2\",\"priority\":10}],\"networkFirewallStatelessDefaultActions\":[\"aws:pass\",\"custom1\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessFragmentDefaultActions\":[\"custom2\",\"aws:pass\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessCustomActions\":[{\"actionName\":\"custom1\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension1\"}]}}},{\"actionName\":\"custom2\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension2\"}]}}}],\"networkFirewallStatefulRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateful-rulegroup/rulegroup1\"}],\"networkFirewallOrchestrationConfig\":{\"singleFirewallEndpointPerVPC\":true,\"allowedIPV4CidrList\":[\"10.24.34.0/28\"]}
--   }"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>WAFV2</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"WAFV2\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupArn\":null,\"overrideAction\":{\"type\":\"NONE\"},\"managedRuleGroupIdentifier\":{\"version\":null,\"vendorName\":\"AWS\",\"managedRuleGroupName\":\"AWSManagedRulesAmazonIpReputationList\"},\"ruleGroupType\":\"ManagedRuleGroup\",\"excludeRules\":[{\"name\":\"NoUserAgent_HEADER\"}]}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[],\"defaultAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"},\"overrideCustomerWebACLAssociation\":false,\"loggingConfiguration\":{\"logDestinationConfigs\":[\"arn:aws:firehose:us-west-2:12345678912:deliverystream/aws-waf-logs-fms-admin-destination\"],\"redactedFields\":[{\"redactedFieldType\":\"SingleHeader\",\"redactedFieldValue\":\"Cookies\"},{\"redactedFieldType\":\"Method\"}]}}"</pre>In
--   the <tt>loggingConfiguration</tt>, you can specify one
--   <tt>logDestinationConfigs</tt>, you can optionally provide up to 20
--   <tt>redactedFields</tt>, and the <tt>RedactedFieldType</tt> must be
--   one of <tt>URI</tt>, <tt>QUERY_STRING</tt>, <tt>HEADER</tt>, or
--   <tt>METHOD</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>WAF Classic</tt><pre>"{\"type\": \"WAF\",
--   \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\":\"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\",
--   \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\":
--   {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example: Shared VPCs. Apply the preceding policy to resources in
--   shared VPCs as well as to those in VPCs that the account
--   owns<pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"includeSharedVPC\":true,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT\",\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}],\"securityGroupAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"}}"</pre>The
--   security group action for content audit can be <tt>ALLOW</tt> or
--   <tt>DENY</tt>. For <tt>ALLOW</tt>, all in-scope security group rules
--   must be within the allowed range of the policy's security group rules.
--   For <tt>DENY</tt>, all in-scope security group rules must not contain
--   a value or a range that matches a rule value or range in the policy
--   security group.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT\",\"deleteUnusedSecurityGroups\":true,\"coalesceRedundantSecurityGroups\":true}"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SecurityServicePolicyData'</a>,
--   <a>securityServicePolicyData_type</a> - The service that the policy is
--   using to protect the resources. This specifies the type of policy that
--   is created, either an WAF policy, a Shield Advanced policy, or a
--   security group policy. For security group policies, Firewall Manager
--   supports one security group for each common policy and for each
--   content audit policy. This is an adjustable limit that you can
--   increase by contacting Amazon Web Services Support.
newSecurityServicePolicyData :: SecurityServiceType -> SecurityServicePolicyData

-- | Details about the service that are specific to the service type, in
--   JSON format. For service type <tt>SHIELD_ADVANCED</tt>, this is an
--   empty string.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>DNS_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"DNS_FIREWALL\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-1\",\"priority\":10}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-2\",\"priority\":9911}]}"</pre>Valid
--   values for <tt>preProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 1 and 99. Valid
--   values for <tt>postProcessRuleGroups</tt> are between 9901 and
--   10000.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>NETWORK_FIREWALL</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"NETWORK_FIREWALL\",\"networkFirewallStatelessRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateless-rulegroup/rulegroup2\",\"priority\":10}],\"networkFirewallStatelessDefaultActions\":[\"aws:pass\",\"custom1\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessFragmentDefaultActions\":[\"custom2\",\"aws:pass\"],\"networkFirewallStatelessCustomActions\":[{\"actionName\":\"custom1\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension1\"}]}}},{\"actionName\":\"custom2\",\"actionDefinition\":{\"publishMetricAction\":{\"dimensions\":[{\"value\":\"dimension2\"}]}}}],\"networkFirewallStatefulRuleGroupReferences\":[{\"resourceARN\":\"arn:aws:network-firewall:us-west-1:1234567891011:stateful-rulegroup/rulegroup1\"}],\"networkFirewallOrchestrationConfig\":{\"singleFirewallEndpointPerVPC\":true,\"allowedIPV4CidrList\":[\"10.24.34.0/28\"]}
--   }"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>WAFV2</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"WAFV2\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupArn\":null,\"overrideAction\":{\"type\":\"NONE\"},\"managedRuleGroupIdentifier\":{\"version\":null,\"vendorName\":\"AWS\",\"managedRuleGroupName\":\"AWSManagedRulesAmazonIpReputationList\"},\"ruleGroupType\":\"ManagedRuleGroup\",\"excludeRules\":[{\"name\":\"NoUserAgent_HEADER\"}]}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[],\"defaultAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"},\"overrideCustomerWebACLAssociation\":false,\"loggingConfiguration\":{\"logDestinationConfigs\":[\"arn:aws:firehose:us-west-2:12345678912:deliverystream/aws-waf-logs-fms-admin-destination\"],\"redactedFields\":[{\"redactedFieldType\":\"SingleHeader\",\"redactedFieldValue\":\"Cookies\"},{\"redactedFieldType\":\"Method\"}]}}"</pre>In
--   the <tt>loggingConfiguration</tt>, you can specify one
--   <tt>logDestinationConfigs</tt>, you can optionally provide up to 20
--   <tt>redactedFields</tt>, and the <tt>RedactedFieldType</tt> must be
--   one of <tt>URI</tt>, <tt>QUERY_STRING</tt>, <tt>HEADER</tt>, or
--   <tt>METHOD</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>WAF Classic</tt><pre>"{\"type\": \"WAF\",
--   \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\":\"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\",
--   \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\":
--   {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,
--   \"applyToAllEC2InstanceENIs\":false,\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"
--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example: Shared VPCs. Apply the preceding policy to resources in
--   shared VPCs as well as to those in VPCs that the account
--   owns<pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_COMMON\",\"revertManualSecurityGroupChanges\":false,\"exclusiveResourceSecurityGroupManagement\":false,

--   sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}]}"</pre></li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_CONTENT_AUDIT\",\"securityGroups\":[{\"id\":\"sg-000e55995d61a06bd\"}],\"securityGroupAction\":{\"type\":\"ALLOW\"}}"</pre>The
--   security group action for content audit can be <tt>ALLOW</tt> or
--   <tt>DENY</tt>. For <tt>ALLOW</tt>, all in-scope security group rules
--   must be within the allowed range of the policy's security group rules.
--   For <tt>DENY</tt>, all in-scope security group rules must not contain
--   a value or a range that matches a rule value or range in the policy
--   security group.</li>
--   <li>Example:
--   <tt>SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT</tt><pre>"{\"type\":\"SECURITY_GROUPS_USAGE_AUDIT\",\"deleteUnusedSecurityGroups\":true,\"coalesceRedundantSecurityGroups\":true}"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
securityServicePolicyData_managedServiceData :: Lens' SecurityServicePolicyData (Maybe Text)

-- | The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This
--   specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a
--   Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy. For security group
--   policies, Firewall Manager supports one security group for each common
--   policy and for each content audit policy. This is an adjustable limit
--   that you can increase by contacting Amazon Web Services Support.
securityServicePolicyData_type :: Lens' SecurityServicePolicyData SecurityServiceType

-- | Network Firewall stateful rule group, used in a
--   NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatefulRuleGroup</a> smart constructor.
data StatefulRuleGroup
StatefulRuleGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StatefulRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
[$sel:resourceId:StatefulRuleGroup'] :: StatefulRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the rule group.
[$sel:ruleGroupName:StatefulRuleGroup'] :: StatefulRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StatefulRuleGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:StatefulRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statefulRuleGroup_resourceId</a> - The resource ID of the rule
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleGroupName:StatefulRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statefulRuleGroup_ruleGroupName</a> - The name of the rule group.
newStatefulRuleGroup :: StatefulRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
statefulRuleGroup_resourceId :: Lens' StatefulRuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the rule group.
statefulRuleGroup_ruleGroupName :: Lens' StatefulRuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Network Firewall stateless rule group, used in a
--   NetworkFirewallPolicyDescription.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatelessRuleGroup</a> smart constructor.
data StatelessRuleGroup
StatelessRuleGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> StatelessRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
[$sel:resourceId:StatelessRuleGroup'] :: StatelessRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The priority of the rule group. Network Firewall evaluates the
--   stateless rule groups in a firewall policy starting from the lowest
--   priority setting.
[$sel:priority:StatelessRuleGroup'] :: StatelessRuleGroup -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of the rule group.
[$sel:ruleGroupName:StatelessRuleGroup'] :: StatelessRuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StatelessRuleGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:StatelessRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statelessRuleGroup_resourceId</a> - The resource ID of the rule
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:StatelessRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statelessRuleGroup_priority</a> - The priority of the rule group.
--   Network Firewall evaluates the stateless rule groups in a firewall
--   policy starting from the lowest priority setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleGroupName:StatelessRuleGroup'</a>,
--   <a>statelessRuleGroup_ruleGroupName</a> - The name of the rule group.
newStatelessRuleGroup :: StatelessRuleGroup

-- | The resource ID of the rule group.
statelessRuleGroup_resourceId :: Lens' StatelessRuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The priority of the rule group. Network Firewall evaluates the
--   stateless rule groups in a firewall policy starting from the lowest
--   priority setting.
statelessRuleGroup_priority :: Lens' StatelessRuleGroup (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the rule group.
statelessRuleGroup_ruleGroupName :: Lens' StatelessRuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A collection of key:value pairs associated with an Amazon Web Services
--   resource. The key:value pair can be anything you define. Typically,
--   the tag key represents a category (such as "environment") and the tag
--   value represents a specific value within that category (such as
--   "test," "development," or "production"). You can add up to 50 tags to
--   each Amazon Web Services resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag key
--   to describe a category of information, such as "customer." Tag keys
--   are case-sensitive.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag value
--   to describe a specific value within a category, such as "companyA" or
--   "companyB." Tag values are case-sensitive.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Part of the key:value pair that
--   defines a tag. You can use a tag key to describe a category of
--   information, such as "customer." Tag keys are case-sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Part of the key:value pair
--   that defines a tag. You can use a tag value to describe a specific
--   value within a category, such as "companyA" or "companyB." Tag values
--   are case-sensitive.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag key
--   to describe a category of information, such as "customer." Tag keys
--   are case-sensitive.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Part of the key:value pair that defines a tag. You can use a tag value
--   to describe a specific value within a category, such as "companyA" or
--   "companyB." Tag values are case-sensitive.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Violations for a resource based on the specified Firewall Manager
--   policy and Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newViolationDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ViolationDetail
ViolationDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> [ResourceViolation] -> ViolationDetail

-- | Brief description for the requested resource.
[$sel:resourceDescription:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects associated with the resource.
[$sel:resourceTags:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that the violation details were
--   requested for.
[$sel:policyId:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that the violation details were
--   requested for.
[$sel:memberAccount:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | The resource ID that the violation details were requested for.
[$sel:resourceId:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | The resource type that the violation details were requested for.
[$sel:resourceType:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> Text

-- | List of violations for the requested resource.
[$sel:resourceViolations:ViolationDetail'] :: ViolationDetail -> [ResourceViolation]

-- | Create a value of <a>ViolationDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceDescription:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceDescription</a> - Brief description for the
--   requested resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTags:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceTags</a> - The <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects
--   associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:ViolationDetail'</a>, <a>violationDetail_policyId</a>
--   - The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that the violation details
--   were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_memberAccount</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   that the violation details were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceId</a> - The resource ID that the violation
--   details were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceType</a> - The resource type that the
--   violation details were requested for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceViolations:ViolationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>violationDetail_resourceViolations</a> - List of violations for the
--   requested resource.
newViolationDetail :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ViolationDetail

-- | Brief description for the requested resource.
violationDetail_resourceDescription :: Lens' ViolationDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>ResourceTag</tt> objects associated with the resource.
violationDetail_resourceTags :: Lens' ViolationDetail (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that the violation details were
--   requested for.
violationDetail_policyId :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that the violation details were
--   requested for.
violationDetail_memberAccount :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | The resource ID that the violation details were requested for.
violationDetail_resourceId :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | The resource type that the violation details were requested for.
violationDetail_resourceType :: Lens' ViolationDetail Text

-- | List of violations for the requested resource.
violationDetail_resourceViolations :: Lens' ViolationDetail [ResourceViolation]


-- | Adds one or more tags to an Amazon Web Services resource.
module Network.AWS.FMS.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> [Tag] -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to return tags for. The
--   Firewall Manager resources that support tagging are policies,
--   applications lists, and protocols lists.
[$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | The tags to add to the resource.
[$sel:tagList:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to return tags for. The
--   Firewall Manager resources that support tagging are policies,
--   applications lists, and protocols lists.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tagList</a> - The
--   tags to add to the resource.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to return tags for. The
--   Firewall Manager resources that support tagging are policies,
--   applications lists, and protocols lists.
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | The tags to add to the resource.
tagResource_tagList :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

-- | Creates an Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   Firewall Manager provides the following types of policies:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An WAF policy (type WAFV2), which defines rule groups to run first
--   in the corresponding WAF web ACL and rule groups to run last in the
--   web ACL.</li>
--   <li>An WAF Classic policy (type WAF), which defines a rule group.</li>
--   <li>A Shield Advanced policy, which applies Shield Advanced protection
--   to specified accounts and resources.</li>
--   <li>A security group policy, which manages VPC security groups across
--   your Amazon Web Services organization.</li>
--   <li>An Network Firewall policy, which provides firewall rules to
--   filter network traffic in specified Amazon VPCs.</li>
--   <li>A DNS Firewall policy, which provides Route 53 Resolver DNS
--   Firewall rules to filter DNS queries for specified VPCs.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Each policy is specific to one of the types. If you want to enforce
--   more than one policy type across accounts, create multiple policies.
--   You can create multiple policies for each type.
--   
--   You must be subscribed to Shield Advanced to create a Shield Advanced
--   policy. For more information about subscribing to Shield Advanced, see
--   <a>CreateSubscription</a>.
module Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data PutPolicy
PutPolicy' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Policy -> PutPolicy

-- | The tags to add to the Amazon Web Services resource.
[$sel:tagList:PutPolicy'] :: PutPolicy -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The details of the Firewall Manager policy to be created.
[$sel:policy:PutPolicy'] :: PutPolicy -> Policy

-- | Create a value of <a>PutPolicy</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:PutPolicy'</a>, <a>putPolicy_tagList</a> - The tags to
--   add to the Amazon Web Services resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policy:PutPolicy'</a>, <a>putPolicy_policy</a> - The details
--   of the Firewall Manager policy to be created.
newPutPolicy :: Policy -> PutPolicy

-- | The tags to add to the Amazon Web Services resource.
putPolicy_tagList :: Lens' PutPolicy (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The details of the Firewall Manager policy to be created.
putPolicy_policy :: Lens' PutPolicy Policy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutPolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PutPolicyResponse
PutPolicyResponse' :: Maybe Policy -> Maybe Text -> Int -> PutPolicyResponse

-- | The details of the Firewall Manager policy.
[$sel:policy:PutPolicyResponse'] :: PutPolicyResponse -> Maybe Policy

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
[$sel:policyArn:PutPolicyResponse'] :: PutPolicyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:PutPolicyResponse'] :: PutPolicyResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>PutPolicyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policy:PutPolicy'</a>, <a>putPolicyResponse_policy</a> - The
--   details of the Firewall Manager policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyArn:PutPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putPolicyResponse_policyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putPolicyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newPutPolicyResponse :: Int -> PutPolicyResponse

-- | The details of the Firewall Manager policy.
putPolicyResponse_policy :: Lens' PutPolicyResponse (Maybe Policy)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
putPolicyResponse_policyArn :: Lens' PutPolicyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
putPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutPolicyResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicyResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicyResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.FMS.PutPolicy.PutPolicy


-- | Designates the IAM role and Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)
--   topic that Firewall Manager uses to record SNS logs.
--   
--   To perform this action outside of the console, you must configure the
--   SNS topic to allow the Firewall Manager role
--   <tt>AWSServiceRoleForFMS</tt> to publish SNS logs. For more
--   information, see <a>Firewall Manager required permissions for API
--   actions</a> in the <i>Firewall Manager Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.FMS.PutNotificationChannel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutNotificationChannel</a> smart constructor.
data PutNotificationChannel
PutNotificationChannel' :: Text -> Text -> PutNotificationChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic that collects
--   notifications from Firewall Manager.
[$sel:snsTopicArn:PutNotificationChannel'] :: PutNotificationChannel -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that allows Amazon SNS
--   to record Firewall Manager activity.
[$sel:snsRoleName:PutNotificationChannel'] :: PutNotificationChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutNotificationChannel</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:PutNotificationChannel'</a>,
--   <a>putNotificationChannel_snsTopicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the SNS topic that collects notifications from Firewall
--   Manager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsRoleName:PutNotificationChannel'</a>,
--   <a>putNotificationChannel_snsRoleName</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the IAM role that allows Amazon SNS to record Firewall
--   Manager activity.
newPutNotificationChannel :: Text -> Text -> PutNotificationChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic that collects
--   notifications from Firewall Manager.
putNotificationChannel_snsTopicArn :: Lens' PutNotificationChannel Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that allows Amazon SNS
--   to record Firewall Manager activity.
putNotificationChannel_snsRoleName :: Lens' PutNotificationChannel Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutNotificationChannelResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

-- | Creates an Firewall Manager applications list.

-- | The details of the Firewall Manager applications list to be created.

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAppsList</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:PutAppsList'</a>, <a>putAppsList_tagList</a> - The
--   tags associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appsList:PutAppsList'</a>, <a>putAppsList_appsList</a> - The
--   details of the Firewall Manager applications list to be created.
newPutAppsList :: AppsListData -> PutAppsList

-- | The tags associated with the resource.
putAppsList_tagList :: Lens' PutAppsList (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The details of the Firewall Manager applications list to be created.
putAppsList_appsList :: Lens' PutAppsList AppsListData

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAppsListResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PutAppsListResponse
PutAppsListResponse' :: Maybe AppsListData -> Maybe Text -> Int -> PutAppsListResponse

-- | The details of the Firewall Manager applications list.
[$sel:appsList:PutAppsListResponse'] :: PutAppsListResponse -> Maybe AppsListData

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the applications list.

-- | The response's http status code.

--   omitted.

--   (ARN) of the applications list.
--

--   <a>putAppsListResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the applications list.

-- | Retrieves the list of tags for the specified Amazon Web Services
--   resource.

--   Firewall Manager resources that support tagging are policies,
--   applications lists, and protocols lists.

--   protocols lists.

-- | Returns an array of <tt>ProtocolsListDataSummary</tt> objects.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.FMS.ListProtocolsLists

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListProtocolsLists</a> smart constructor.
data ListProtocolsLists
ListProtocolsLists' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Natural -> ListProtocolsLists

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> in your list request,
--   and you have more objects than the maximum, Firewall Manager returns
--   this token in the response. For all but the first request, you provide
--   the token returned by the prior request in the request parameters, to
--   retrieve the next batch of objects.
[$sel:nextToken:ListProtocolsLists'] :: ListProtocolsLists -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the lists to retrieve are default lists owned by
--   Firewall Manager.
[$sel:defaultLists:ListProtocolsLists'] :: ListProtocolsLists -> Maybe Bool

-- | The maximum number of objects that you want Firewall Manager to return
--   for this request. If more objects are available, in the response,
--   Firewall Manager provides a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use
--   in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects.
--   
--   If you don't specify this, Firewall Manager returns all available
--   objects.
[$sel:maxResults:ListProtocolsLists'] :: ListProtocolsLists -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListProtocolsLists</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>listProtocolsLists_nextToken</a> - If you specify a value for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> in your list request, and you have more objects
--   than the maximum, Firewall Manager returns this token in the response.
--   For all but the first request, you provide the token returned by the
--   prior request in the request parameters, to retrieve the next batch of
--   objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultLists:ListProtocolsLists'</a>,
--   <a>listProtocolsLists_defaultLists</a> - Specifies whether the lists
--   to retrieve are default lists owned by Firewall Manager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListProtocolsLists'</a>,
--   <a>listProtocolsLists_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of objects
--   that you want Firewall Manager to return for this request. If more
--   objects are available, in the response, Firewall Manager provides a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use in a subsequent call to get
--   the next batch of objects.
--   
--   If you don't specify this, Firewall Manager returns all available
--   objects.

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> in your list request,
--   and you have more objects than the maximum, Firewall Manager returns
--   this token in the response. For all but the first request, you provide
--   the token returned by the prior request in the request parameters, to
--   retrieve the next batch of objects.

--   Firewall Manager.

--   for this request. If more objects are available, in the response,
--   Firewall Manager provides a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use
--   in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects.
--

--   objects.

-- | Returns an array of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.FMS.ListPolicies

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPolicies</a> smart constructor.
data ListPolicies
ListPolicies' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListPolicies

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that you specify for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt>, Firewall Manager returns a <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   value in the response that allows you to list another group of
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects. For the second and subsequent
--   <tt>ListPolicies</tt> requests, specify the value of
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> from the previous response to get information about
--   another batch of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPolicies'] :: ListPolicies -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the number of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects that you want
--   Firewall Manager to return for this request. If you have more
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that you specify for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt>, the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value
--   that you can use to get another batch of <tt>PolicySummary</tt>
--   objects.
[$sel:maxResults:ListPolicies'] :: ListPolicies -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPolicies</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPolicies'</a>, <a>listPolicies_nextToken</a> -
--   If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that you specify for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt>, Firewall Manager returns a <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   value in the response that allows you to list another group of
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects. For the second and subsequent
--   <tt>ListPolicies</tt> requests, specify the value of
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> from the previous response to get information about
--   another batch of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPolicies'</a>, <a>listPolicies_maxResults</a> -
--   Specifies the number of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects that you want
--   Firewall Manager to return for this request. If you have more
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that you specify for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt>, the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value
--   that you can use to get another batch of <tt>PolicySummary</tt>
--   objects.
newListPolicies :: ListPolicies

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that you specify for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt>, Firewall Manager returns a <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   value in the response that allows you to list another group of
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects. For the second and subsequent
--   <tt>ListPolicies</tt> requests, specify the value of
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> from the previous response to get information about
--   another batch of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects.
listPolicies_nextToken :: Lens' ListPolicies (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the number of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects that you want
--   Firewall Manager to return for this request. If you have more
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that you specify for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt>, the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value
--   that you can use to get another batch of <tt>PolicySummary</tt>
--   objects.
listPolicies_maxResults :: Lens' ListPolicies (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPoliciesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPoliciesResponse
ListPoliciesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicySummary] -> Int -> ListPoliciesResponse

-- | If you have more <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that
--   you specified for <tt>MaxResults</tt> in the request, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value. To list more
--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects, submit another <tt>ListPolicies</tt>
--   request, and specify the <tt>NextToken</tt> value from the response in
--   the <tt>NextToken</tt> value in the next request.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPoliciesResponse'] :: ListPoliciesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects.
[$sel:policyList:ListPoliciesResponse'] :: ListPoliciesResponse -> Maybe [PolicySummary]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListPoliciesResponse'] :: ListPoliciesResponse -> Int

--   omitted.

--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects than the number that you specified for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> in the request, the response includes a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value. To list more <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects,
--   submit another <tt>ListPolicies</tt> request, and specify the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value from the response in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   value in the next request.
--

--   <tt>PolicySummary</tt> objects.
--

--   code.
newListPoliciesResponse :: Int -> ListPoliciesResponse

-- | Returns a <tt>MemberAccounts</tt> object that lists the member
--   accounts in the administrator's Amazon Web Services organization.
--   
--   The <tt>ListMemberAccounts</tt> must be submitted by the account that
--   is set as the Firewall Manager administrator.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.FMS.ListMemberAccounts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListMemberAccounts</a> smart constructor.
data ListMemberAccounts
ListMemberAccounts' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListMemberAccounts

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   account IDs than the number that you specify for <tt>MaxResults</tt>,
--   Firewall Manager returns a <tt>NextToken</tt> value in the response
--   that allows you to list another group of IDs. For the second and
--   subsequent <tt>ListMemberAccountsRequest</tt> requests, specify the
--   value of <tt>NextToken</tt> from the previous response to get
--   information about another batch of member account IDs.
[$sel:nextToken:ListMemberAccounts'] :: ListMemberAccounts -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the number of member account IDs that you want Firewall
--   Manager to return for this request. If you have more IDs than the
--   number that you specify for <tt>MaxResults</tt>, the response includes
--   a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use to get another batch of
--   member account IDs.
[$sel:maxResults:ListMemberAccounts'] :: ListMemberAccounts -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListMemberAccounts</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListMemberAccounts'</a>,
--   <a>listMemberAccounts_nextToken</a> - If you specify a value for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more account IDs than the number that
--   you specify for <tt>MaxResults</tt>, Firewall Manager returns a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value in the response that allows you to list
--   another group of IDs. For the second and subsequent
--   <tt>ListMemberAccountsRequest</tt> requests, specify the value of
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> from the previous response to get information about
--   another batch of member account IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListMemberAccounts'</a>,
--   <a>listMemberAccounts_maxResults</a> - Specifies the number of member
--   account IDs that you want Firewall Manager to return for this request.
--   If you have more IDs than the number that you specify for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt>, the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value
--   that you can use to get another batch of member account IDs.
newListMemberAccounts :: ListMemberAccounts

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   account IDs than the number that you specify for <tt>MaxResults</tt>,
--   Firewall Manager returns a <tt>NextToken</tt> value in the response
--   that allows you to list another group of IDs. For the second and
--   subsequent <tt>ListMemberAccountsRequest</tt> requests, specify the
--   value of <tt>NextToken</tt> from the previous response to get
--   information about another batch of member account IDs.
listMemberAccounts_nextToken :: Lens' ListMemberAccounts (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the number of member account IDs that you want Firewall
--   Manager to return for this request. If you have more IDs than the
--   number that you specify for <tt>MaxResults</tt>, the response includes
--   a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use to get another batch of
--   member account IDs.
listMemberAccounts_maxResults :: Lens' ListMemberAccounts (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListMemberAccountsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListMemberAccountsResponse
ListMemberAccountsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Int -> ListMemberAccountsResponse

-- | If you have more member account IDs than the number that you specified
--   for <tt>MaxResults</tt> in the request, the response includes a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value. To list more IDs, submit another
--   <tt>ListMemberAccounts</tt> request, and specify the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value from the response in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   value in the next request.
[$sel:nextToken:ListMemberAccountsResponse'] :: ListMemberAccountsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of account IDs.
[$sel:memberAccounts:ListMemberAccountsResponse'] :: ListMemberAccountsResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListMemberAccountsResponse'] :: ListMemberAccountsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListMemberAccountsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListMemberAccounts'</a>,
--   <a>listMemberAccountsResponse_nextToken</a> - If you have more member
--   account IDs than the number that you specified for <tt>MaxResults</tt>
--   in the request, the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value. To
--   list more IDs, submit another <tt>ListMemberAccounts</tt> request, and
--   specify the <tt>NextToken</tt> value from the response in the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value in the next request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccounts:ListMemberAccountsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listMemberAccountsResponse_memberAccounts</a> - An array of account
--   IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListMemberAccountsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listMemberAccountsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

-- | If you have more member account IDs than the number that you specified

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value. To list more IDs, submit another
--   <tt>ListMemberAccounts</tt> request, and specify the

--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   <tt>PolicyComplianceStatus</tt> objects than the number that you

-- | Returns an array of <tt>AppsListDataSummary</tt> objects.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.FMS.ListAppsLists

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAppsLists</a> smart constructor.
data ListAppsLists
ListAppsLists' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Natural -> ListAppsLists

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> in your list request,
--   and you have more objects than the maximum, Firewall Manager returns
--   this token in the response. For all but the first request, you provide
--   the token returned by the prior request in the request parameters, to
--   retrieve the next batch of objects.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAppsLists'] :: ListAppsLists -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the lists to retrieve are default lists owned by
--   Firewall Manager.
[$sel:defaultLists:ListAppsLists'] :: ListAppsLists -> Maybe Bool

-- | The maximum number of objects that you want Firewall Manager to return
--   for this request. If more objects are available, in the response,
--   Firewall Manager provides a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use
--   in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects.
--   
--   If you don't specify this, Firewall Manager returns all available
--   objects.
[$sel:maxResults:ListAppsLists'] :: ListAppsLists -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAppsLists</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAppsLists'</a>, <a>listAppsLists_nextToken</a> -
--   If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> in your list request,
--   and you have more objects than the maximum, Firewall Manager returns
--   this token in the response. For all but the first request, you provide
--   the token returned by the prior request in the request parameters, to
--   retrieve the next batch of objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultLists:ListAppsLists'</a>,
--   <a>listAppsLists_defaultLists</a> - Specifies whether the lists to
--   retrieve are default lists owned by Firewall Manager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAppsLists'</a>, <a>listAppsLists_maxResults</a>
--   - The maximum number of objects that you want Firewall Manager to
--   return for this request. If more objects are available, in the
--   response, Firewall Manager provides a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that
--   you can use in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects.
--   
--   If you don't specify this, Firewall Manager returns all available
--   objects.
newListAppsLists :: Natural -> ListAppsLists

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> in your list request,
--   and you have more objects than the maximum, Firewall Manager returns
--   this token in the response. For all but the first request, you provide
--   the token returned by the prior request in the request parameters, to
--   retrieve the next batch of objects.
listAppsLists_nextToken :: Lens' ListAppsLists (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the lists to retrieve are default lists owned by
--   Firewall Manager.
listAppsLists_defaultLists :: Lens' ListAppsLists (Maybe Bool)

-- | The maximum number of objects that you want Firewall Manager to return
--   for this request. If more objects are available, in the response,
--   Firewall Manager provides a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use
--   in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects.
--   
--   If you don't specify this, Firewall Manager returns all available
--   objects.
listAppsLists_maxResults :: Lens' ListAppsLists Natural

-- | Retrieves violations for a resource based on the specified Firewall
--   Manager policy and Amazon Web Services account.
module Network.AWS.FMS.GetViolationDetails

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetViolationDetails</a> smart constructor.
data GetViolationDetails
GetViolationDetails' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetViolationDetails

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that you want the details for.
--   This currently only supports security group content audit policies.
[$sel:policyId:GetViolationDetails'] :: GetViolationDetails -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID that you want the details for.
[$sel:memberAccount:GetViolationDetails'] :: GetViolationDetails -> Text

-- | The ID of the resource that has violations.
[$sel:resourceId:GetViolationDetails'] :: GetViolationDetails -> Text

-- | The resource type. This is in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web
--   Services Resource Types Reference</a>. Supported resource types are:
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>, <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy</tt>, and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Subnet</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:GetViolationDetails'] :: GetViolationDetails -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetViolationDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:GetViolationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getViolationDetails_policyId</a> - The ID of the Firewall Manager
--   policy that you want the details for. This currently only supports
--   security group content audit policies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:GetViolationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getViolationDetails_memberAccount</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account ID that you want the details for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:GetViolationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getViolationDetails_resourceId</a> - The ID of the resource that
--   has violations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:GetViolationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getViolationDetails_resourceType</a> - The resource type. This is
--   in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types
--   Reference</a>. Supported resource types are:
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>, <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy</tt>, and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Subnet</tt>.
newGetViolationDetails :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetViolationDetails

-- | The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that you want the details for.
--   This currently only supports security group content audit policies.
getViolationDetails_policyId :: Lens' GetViolationDetails Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID that you want the details for.
getViolationDetails_memberAccount :: Lens' GetViolationDetails Text

-- | The ID of the resource that has violations.
getViolationDetails_resourceId :: Lens' GetViolationDetails Text

-- | The resource type. This is in the format shown in the <a>Amazon Web
--   Services Resource Types Reference</a>. Supported resource types are:
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>, <tt>AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy</tt>, and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Subnet</tt>.
getViolationDetails_resourceType :: Lens' GetViolationDetails Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetViolationDetailsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetViolationDetailsResponse
GetViolationDetailsResponse' :: Maybe ViolationDetail -> Int -> GetViolationDetailsResponse

-- | Violation detail for a resource.
[$sel:violationDetail:GetViolationDetailsResponse'] :: GetViolationDetailsResponse -> Maybe ViolationDetail

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetViolationDetailsResponse'] :: GetViolationDetailsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetViolationDetailsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationDetail:GetViolationDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getViolationDetailsResponse_violationDetail</a> - Violation detail
--   for a resource.

-- | If you created a Shield Advanced policy, returns policy-level attack
--   summary information in the event of a potential DDoS attack. Other
--   policy types are currently unsupported.
module Network.AWS.FMS.GetProtectionStatus

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetProtectionStatus</a> smart constructor.
data GetProtectionStatus
GetProtectionStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> GetProtectionStatus

-- | If you specify a value for <tt>MaxResults</tt> and you have more
--   objects than the number that you specify for <tt>MaxResults</tt>,
--   Firewall Manager returns a <tt>NextToken</tt> value in the response,
--   which you can use to retrieve another group of objects. For the second
--   and subsequent <tt>GetProtectionStatus</tt> requests, specify the
--   value of <tt>NextToken</tt> from the previous response to get
--   information about another batch of objects.
[$sel:nextToken:GetProtectionStatus'] :: GetProtectionStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the number of objects that you want Firewall Manager to
--   return for this request. If you have more objects than the number that
--   you specify for <tt>MaxResults</tt>, the response includes a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can use to get another batch of
--   objects.
[$sel:maxResults:GetProtectionStatus'] :: GetProtectionStatus -> Maybe Natural

-- | The start of the time period to query for the attacks. This is a
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> type. The request syntax listing indicates a
--   <tt>number</tt> type because the default used by Firewall Manager is
--   Unix time in seconds. However, any valid <tt>timestamp</tt> format is
--   allowed.
[$sel:startTime:GetProtectionStatus'] :: GetProtectionStatus -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The end of the time period to query for the attacks. This is a
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> type. The request syntax listing indicates a
--   <tt>number</tt> type because the default used by Firewall Manager is
--   Unix time in seconds. However, any valid <tt>timestamp</tt> format is
--   allowed.
[$sel:endTime:GetProtectionStatus'] :: GetProtectionStatus -> Maybe POSIX

--   you want to get the details for.
[$sel:memberAccountId:GetProtectionStatus'] :: GetProtectionStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the policy for which you want to get the attack information.
[$sel:policyId:GetProtectionStatus'] :: GetProtectionStatus -> Text

--   omitted.

-- | If you have more objects than the number that you specified for
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> in the request, the response includes a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value. To list more objects, submit another
--   <tt>GetProtectionStatus</tt> request, and specify the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value from the response in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   value in the next request.

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> in a response and make subsequent request calls
--   automatically on your behalf. However, this feature is not supported
--   by <tt>GetProtectionStatus</tt>. You must submit subsequent requests
--   with <tt>NextToken</tt> using your own processes.

[$sel:adminAccountId:GetProtectionStatusResponse'] :: GetProtectionStatusResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Details about the attack, including the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Attack type</li>
--   <li>Account ID</li>
--   <li>ARN of the resource attacked</li>
--   <li>Start time of the attack</li>
--   <li>End time of the attack (ongoing attacks will not have an end
--   time)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The details are in JSON format.
[$sel:data':GetProtectionStatusResponse'] :: GetProtectionStatusResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The service type that is protected by the policy. Currently, this is
--   always <tt>SHIELD_ADVANCED</tt>.
[$sel:serviceType:GetProtectionStatusResponse'] :: GetProtectionStatusResponse -> Maybe SecurityServiceType

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetProtectionStatusResponse'] :: GetProtectionStatusResponse -> Int

-- | Information about the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic

module Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel

[$sel:httpStatus:GetNotificationChannelResponse'] :: GetNotificationChannelResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetNotificationChannelResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   is used by Firewall Manager to record activity to SNS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:GetNotificationChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getNotificationChannelResponse_snsTopicArn</a> - The SNS topic that
--   records Firewall Manager activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetNotificationChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getNotificationChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetNotificationChannelResponse :: Int -> GetNotificationChannelResponse

-- | The IAM role that is used by Firewall Manager to record activity to
--   SNS.
getNotificationChannelResponse_snsRoleName :: Lens' GetNotificationChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The SNS topic that records Firewall Manager activity.
getNotificationChannelResponse_snsTopicArn :: Lens' GetNotificationChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getNotificationChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetNotificationChannelResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannel
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannelResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannelResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannelResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.FMS.GetNotificationChannel.GetNotificationChannel


-- | Returns detailed compliance information about the specified member
--   account. Details include resources that are in and out of compliance
--   with the specified policy.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Resources are considered noncompliant for WAF and Shield Advanced
--   policies if the specified policy has not been applied to them.</li>
--   <li>Resources are considered noncompliant for security group policies
--   if they are in scope of the policy, they violate one or more of the
--   policy rules, and remediation is disabled or not possible.</li>
--   <li>Resources are considered noncompliant for Network Firewall
--   policies if a firewall is missing in the VPC, if the firewall endpoint
--   isn't set up in an expected Availability Zone and subnet, if a subnet
--   created by the Firewall Manager doesn't have the expected route table,
--   and for modifications to a firewall policy that violate the Firewall
--   Manager policy's rules.</li>
--   <li>Resources are considered noncompliant for DNS Firewall policies if
--   a DNS Firewall rule group is missing from the rule group associations
--   for the VPC.</li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.FMS.GetComplianceDetail

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetComplianceDetail</a> smart constructor.
data GetComplianceDetail
GetComplianceDetail' :: Text -> Text -> GetComplianceDetail

-- | The ID of the policy that you want to get the details for.
--   <tt>PolicyId</tt> is returned by <tt>PutPolicy</tt> and by
--   <tt>ListPolicies</tt>.
[$sel:policyId:GetComplianceDetail'] :: GetComplianceDetail -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that owns the resources that you want
--   to get the details for.
[$sel:memberAccount:GetComplianceDetail'] :: GetComplianceDetail -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetComplianceDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:GetComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>getComplianceDetail_policyId</a> - The ID of the policy that you
--   want to get the details for. <tt>PolicyId</tt> is returned by
--   <tt>PutPolicy</tt> and by <tt>ListPolicies</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memberAccount:GetComplianceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>getComplianceDetail_memberAccount</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns the resources that you want to get the details for.
newGetComplianceDetail :: Text -> Text -> GetComplianceDetail

-- | The ID of the policy that you want to get the details for.
--   <tt>PolicyId</tt> is returned by <tt>PutPolicy</tt> and by
--   <tt>ListPolicies</tt>.
getComplianceDetail_policyId :: Lens' GetComplianceDetail Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account that owns the resources that you want
--   to get the details for.
getComplianceDetail_memberAccount :: Lens' GetComplianceDetail Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetComplianceDetailResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetComplianceDetailResponse
GetComplianceDetailResponse' :: Maybe PolicyComplianceDetail -> Int -> GetComplianceDetailResponse

-- | Information about the resources and the policy that you specified in
--   the <tt>GetComplianceDetail</tt> request.
[$sel:policyComplianceDetail:GetComplianceDetailResponse'] :: GetComplianceDetailResponse -> Maybe PolicyComplianceDetail

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetComplianceDetailResponse'] :: GetComplianceDetailResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetComplianceDetailResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyComplianceDetail:GetComplianceDetailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getComplianceDetailResponse_policyComplianceDetail</a> -
--   Information about the resources and the policy that you specified in
--   the <tt>GetComplianceDetail</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetComplianceDetailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getComplianceDetailResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetComplianceDetailResponse :: Int -> GetComplianceDetailResponse

-- | Information about the resources and the policy that you specified in
--   the <tt>GetComplianceDetail</tt> request.
getComplianceDetailResponse_policyComplianceDetail :: Lens' GetComplianceDetailResponse (Maybe PolicyComplianceDetail)

-- | The response's http status code.
getComplianceDetailResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetComplianceDetailResponse Int

-- | Permanently deletes an Firewall Manager protocols list.
